original: grva yang rung grva phyed kyang rung 'di ni spongs pa yin no //
analyzed: grva yang rung grva phyed kyang rung 'di ni spongs pa yin no //
translated: It is also a downfall to do this in the aisles or in the half-aisles.🔽If there are many or only one,

original: gal te du ma nyid dam gcig la zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: gal te du ma nyid dam gcig la zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: the text says:

original: gnyis kyis grva gcig tu smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis grva gcig tu smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Do not speak with two people in one place.”

original: gang smra bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang smra bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If you do speak with them, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If you speak with someone who is older,

original: rgan rims kyis so zhes bya ba 'di la yang /
analyzed: rgan rims kyis so zhes bya ba 'di la yang /
translated: the text says:🔽“If there are many, speak with one at a time.”

original: sngar gal te du ma nyid yin na gcig gis so zhes smos pas de'i rjes su sbyar gyi bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la log go //🔽du ma nyid la gnas pas rgyan rims kyis bstan par bya zhes bya pa'i don to //🔽gal te mang ba nyid yin na stan gnyis sam gsum gzhag ste'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar gal te du ma nyid yin na gcig gis so zhes smos pas de'i rjes su sbyar gyi bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la log go // du ma nyid la gnas pas rgyan rims kyis bstan par bya zhes bya pa'i don to // gal te mang ba nyid yin na stan gnyis sam gsum gzhag ste'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means that you should not speak with many people at the same time.🔽If there are many, set out two or three seats and sit down.

original: gal te rang gi 'khor mang ba nyid du gyur na de dag gi go gnyis sam gsum gong du gzhag nas /
analyzed: gal te rang gi 'khor mang ba nyid du gyur na de dag gi go gnyis sam gsum gong du gzhag nas /
translated: If your retinue is large, set out two or three extra seats and sit down.

original: des rabs dang nye bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: des rabs dang nye bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then you should speak with them in order of seniority.

original: ci gang yang rung bas sam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci gang yang rung bas sam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one asks, “Is it by any one of them?” the answer is no.

original: de'i phyir gal te stan de dag ma thob pa yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te stan de dag ma thob pa yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If one has not obtained those seats.”

original: gang gis gnyis sam gsum gyis stan de dag mi thob pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gis gnyis sam gsum gyis stan de dag mi thob pa yin na /
translated: If one has not obtained those seats by two or three,

original: des de dag dor nas gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gang gis gnyis mi thob pa des kyang gnyis gzhag par bya /
analyzed: des de dag dor nas gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to // gang gis gnyis mi thob pa des kyang gnyis gzhag par bya /
translated: then one should not abandon them for another.🔽One should understand this in accordance with the following: “If one has not obtained two, one should set out two.

original: gang gis gcig mi thob pa des kyang gcig gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis gcig mi thob pa des kyang gcig gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: If one has not obtained one, one should set out one.”

original: seng ge'i khri la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Also on a lion throne” means

original: gnas shing bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas shing bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should teach while seated.

original: mchil ma'i snod gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil ma dor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba brjod pas go ba'o //
analyzed: mchil ma'i snod gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil ma dor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba brjod pas go ba'o //
translated: “One should set out a spittoon” means that one should set out a spittoon for spitting.

original: 'dir gnyis ka yang @87b brtsams pa ste //
analyzed: 'dir gnyis ka yang @87b brtsams pa ste //
translated: Here both are undertaken.

original: chos smra ba khri stan logs shig tu spags pa la bltas nas 'di smos pa ste /
analyzed: chos smra ba khri stan logs shig tu spags pa la bltas nas 'di smos pa ste /
translated: The Dharma teacher should look at the separate raised seat and say this.

original: seng ge'i khri tsam la ni ma yin na zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri tsam la ni ma yin na zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that on a lion throne is not meant.

original: seng ge'i khri la de smos kyi gzhan la ni shin tu dman pa'i skyon 'di zhes bya ba bsten pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la de smos kyi gzhan la ni shin tu dman pa'i skyon 'di zhes bya ba bsten pa'o //
translated: It is said that on a lion throne, but it is not proper on any other seat.

original: der gcal blugs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der gcal blugs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should pour it into that, it is said.

original: mchil ma'i snod ni snod du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mchil ma'i snod ni snod du rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that spittoon is a container.

original: der gcal ci blugs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: der gcal ci blugs par bya zhe na /
translated: What should one pour into it?

original: de'i phyir bye ma'am thal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bye ma'am thal ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, sand or ashes.

original: de gnyis ni dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de gnyis ni dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: Those two are merely examples.

original: don 'di la gzhan yang rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don 'di la gzhan yang rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this matter, anything else is suitable.

original: de dus dus su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dus dus su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should clean it from time to time, it is said.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mchil ma'i snod de'o ;
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mchil ma'i snod de'o ;
translated: That is, the spittoon.

original: / tshes brgyad dang / bcu bzhi dang / bco lnga'i nub mo chos mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la zhes bya ba de tsam 'dir re zhig rnam par 'byed pa las mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: / tshes brgyad dang / bcu bzhi dang / bco lnga'i nub mo chos mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la zhes bya ba de tsam 'dir re zhig rnam par 'byed pa las mthong ba yin te /
translated: One should listen to the Dharma on the evenings of the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth, it is said. Just that much is seen here in the Vinaya, that is, on the eighth and fourteenth.

original: ma mo las ni tshes bco lnga'i tshig kyang 'dir yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mo las ni tshes bco lnga'i tshig kyang 'dir yod pa yin no //
translated: The word “fifteenth” in the verse is from the Mātṛkā.

original: 'dir chos nyan du gzhug pa rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir chos nyan du gzhug pa rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is proper to listen to the Dharma on this day.

original: de la yang de dus tshigs yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu gtso bo nyid kyi phyir phyi ma dus tshigs kyi zhag dag gis nyams zhes bya ba nges par byas nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la yang de dus tshigs yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu gtso bo nyid kyi phyir phyi ma dus tshigs kyi zhag dag gis nyams zhes bya ba nges par byas nas 'di skad du /
translated: And since it is a special day, it is said that “the day is not lost” because of the following special days.

original: nad pas de ma byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nad pas de ma byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that “there is no offense if the sick person does not do it.”

original: nad pas de chos mnyan pa de mnyan pa dang ma bton pa la nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nad pas de chos mnyan pa de mnyan pa dang ma bton pa la nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if the sick person does not listen to the Dharma or recite it.

original: de smra ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs pa mi gdon par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de smra ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs pa mi gdon par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should not refuse to request the sick person to teach the Dharma.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni chos mnyan pa'i phyir chos la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni chos mnyan pa'i phyir chos la'o //
translated: “The sick person” refers to the Dharma teacher.

original: mi nus pa la sogs pa yin na gsol ba 'debs pa la shad kyis sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nus pa la sogs pa yin na gsol ba 'debs pa la shad kyis sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one is unable to do so, one should request another to do it.”

original: na ste mi nus pa'am bya ba gzhan gyis brel bar gyur pa yin na bya ba gzhan la rtse gcig pa la sogs pa ma yin pa la ni sogs pa'i sgras drangs pa'o //
analyzed: na ste mi nus pa'am bya ba gzhan gyis brel bar gyur pa yin na bya ba gzhan la rtse gcig pa la sogs pa ma yin pa la ni sogs pa'i sgras drangs pa'o //
translated: If he is sick and unable, or if he is busy with some other activity, then he should not be one-pointedly focused on that other activity, and so on. The phrase “and so on” is meant to include other similar cases.

original: smra ba po med na rim gyis dran par bya zhing tha na tshigs su bcad pa re re tsam yang smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba po med na rim gyis dran par bya zhing tha na tshigs su bcad pa re re tsam yang smra bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no one to speak, then he should gradually recall the teachings and, at the very least, recite a single verse.

original: der mar me gzugs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der mar me gzugs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the phrase “he should visualize the lamp,”

original: der zhes bya ba ni chos nyan sa der ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni chos nyan sa der ro //
translated: the word “there” refers to the place where the Dharma is being taught.

original: khyams su chos mnyan pa'i gral ni zla kham gyi rnam pa lta bu'am rdzing bu'i rnam pa lta bur bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyams su chos mnyan pa'i gral ni zla kham gyi rnam pa lta bu'am rdzing bu'i rnam pa lta bur bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line “the rows of listeners should be arranged in the shape of a half-moon or a circle” means

original: 'dir de'i don ni thun mong du dpe tsam du zad de mi gnod pa gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dir de'i don ni thun mong du dpe tsam du zad de mi gnod pa gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
translated: that the meaning of “there” in this context is simply an example and is not meant to be definitive.

original: de bas na nges pa med do //🔽bla gab med @88a * //🔽par chos nyan na bla re gdags so //
analyzed: de bas na nges pa med do // bla gab med @88a * // par chos nyan na bla re gdags so //
translated: Therefore, there is no certainty.🔽If the Dharma is being taught in the open air, a canopy should be set up.

original: rlung dang char 'bab na brtul lo zhes bya ba ni bla re'o //
analyzed: rlung dang char 'bab na brtul lo zhes bya ba ni bla re'o //
translated: If there is wind or rain, the canopy should be closed.”

original: der chos nyan pa dag dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der chos nyan pa dag dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not abandon the Dharma listeners there.

original: der zhes bya ba ni rlung dang char 'bab pa der ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni rlung dang char 'bab pa der ro //
translated: “There” means in the wind and rain.

original: der gnas brtan dang por 'dug ste yud tsam zhig kyang mi smra bar bsdad nas chos smra bar bya ba'am gzhan la dge slong chos smras shig ces gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der gnas brtan dang por 'dug ste yud tsam zhig kyang mi smra bar bsdad nas chos smra bar bya ba'am gzhan la dge slong chos smras shig ces gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The elder should sit down first and, after remaining silent for a moment, request the Dharma teacher to teach or request another to request the monk to teach.

original: gnas brtan zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan no //
analyzed: gnas brtan zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan no //
translated: “Elder” means the elder of the saṅgha.

original: 'dir mi smra bar bsdad nas zhes bya ba ni ku co spang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi smra bar bsdad nas zhes bya ba ni ku co spang ba'i don du'o //
translated: “After remaining silent” means in order to avoid commotion.

original: dang po 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni chos nyan du gzhug par rtsom pa'i dang por ro //
analyzed: dang po 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni chos nyan du gzhug par rtsom pa'i dang por ro //
translated: “First” means at the beginning of the Dharma teaching.

original: der zhes bya ba ni chos nyan pa la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni chos nyan pa la'o //
translated: “There” means in the Dharma listeners.

original: gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan gyis chos ston pa po la chos bstan par gsol ba gdab cing gzhan chos smrar gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan gyis chos ston pa po la chos bstan par gsol ba gdab cing gzhan chos smrar gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “Request” means the elder should request the Dharma teacher to teach the Dharma and should request another to teach.

original: smra ba na sems gtad de chos yin na spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba na sems gtad de chos yin na spro bar bya'o //
translated: When speaking, one should be attentive. If it is the Dharma, one should be delighted.

original: gal te ma yin na bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te ma yin na bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is not, one should stop it.

original: sems gtad de zhes bya ba ni sems gtod du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: sems gtad de zhes bya ba ni sems gtod du gzhug pa'o //
translated: Here, attentive means to be attentive.

original: gal te chos yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te chos smras pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te chos yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te chos smras pa yin na'o //
translated: If it is the Dharma means if it is speaking the Dharma.

original: der khyim pa lhags par rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der khyim pa lhags par rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: When householders have come, one should speak Dharma-related topics.

original: der zhes bya ba ni chos nyan pa de la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni chos nyan pa de la'o //
translated: Here means to the Dharma listener.

original: chos nyan pa'i mthar thug pa la 'gro bar gyur na rtsom pa la shugs kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i mthar thug pa la 'gro bar gyur na rtsom pa la shugs kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If the Dharma listener has reached the end, one should implicitly accomplish what was begun.

original: mu stegs can klan ka tshol zhing gnas na legs par tsher bcad cing khro ba mi bstan par bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mu stegs can klan ka tshol zhing gnas na legs par tsher bcad cing khro ba mi bstan par bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the tīrthikas are dwelling, seeking to find fault, one should be patient, not cutting off their words well, and not showing anger.

original: gnas brtan gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: gang du 'dir bzod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du 'dir bzod par bya zhe na /

original: de'i phyir ston pas 'khor khrid de 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ston pas 'khor khrid de 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: tshur shog bdag gis bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshur shog bdag gis bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //

original: ston pas zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan gyi dbang du byas pa la de dag bzlog pa por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ston pas zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan gyi dbang du byas pa la de dag bzlog pa por rig par bya'o //

original: de dag 'gro na chos kyi sgor gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag 'gro na chos kyi sgor gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de tshol bas gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they should be placed by the search for it.

original: rje sa dang bcas pa dang / gus pa dang bcas pa dang sems dma' bas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rje sa dang bcas pa dang / gus pa dang bcas pa dang sems dma' bas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'khor la zhes bya ba dbang du bya bar gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor la zhes bya ba dbang du bya bar gtogs pa ste /
translated: The retinue is the one who is to be brought under control.

original: rjes dang bcas pa dang gus pa dang bcas pa dang sems dma' bas so //
analyzed: rjes dang bcas pa dang gus pa dang bcas pa dang sems dma' bas so //
translated: With respect, with deference, with humble minds.

analyzed: gus par bya ste bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan la @88b 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid du lta ba'o //

original: sems dma' ba zhes bya ba ni rgyags pa dang nga rgyal nges par bcom pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems dma' ba zhes bya ba ni rgyags pa dang nga rgyal nges par bcom pa nyid kyis so //

original: gus par bya ste brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gus par bya ste brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should speak with respect and with firmness.

original: chos la gus pa dang bcas pa dang brten pa dang yid mi g-yeng bas rigs pa dang grol ba'i tshig dag gis so //
analyzed: chos la gus pa dang bcas pa dang brten pa dang yid mi g-yeng bas rigs pa dang grol ba'i tshig dag gis so //

analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du thogs pa med par brjod pa dag gis so // ma 'dres par ro zhes bya ba ni gtam gzhan dang ma 'dres par ro //

original: 'brel par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'brel par ro zhes bya ba ni /

translated: With a connection between the words and the meaning.🔽With a connection between the words and the meaning.

analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang khong khro ba dang bral zhing mdza' bshes dang ldan pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: With a mind of loving kindness, free from anger and with a mind of friendliness.

original: snying rje'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With a mind of compassion,

analyzed: phan pa nye bar bsgrub par 'dod pas dam pa sngon du btang bas so //

analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With a mind free from material desire,
