analyzed: gnas kyi gzhi de'i yon tan gang yin pas de mos bskyed par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: whatever qualities that basis of residence has, by those he is to be inspired.

original: blang ba la sogs pa ni lhung bzed dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blang ba la sogs pa ni lhung bzed dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The acceptance, etc. are like the alms bowl, it is said.

original: dgos pa blang ba dang blangs pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa blang ba dang blangs pa ma yin pa ste /

analyzed: bar chod pa tshig gnyis pa la mi sbyin zhing phyi ma la ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan la yang 'gre ba'o //

analyzed: mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi don ma yin par seng bar shes pa la ni 'theb nyid las bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One who knows that it is not for the sake of the stupa or the Sangha should be circumambulated from the right, as in the case of the elder.

original: mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi don la ma song ba la ji ltar rgan rims nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan yod pa la btsun pa nye dgas rgan pa gzhan 'ongs pa la bdag nyid dang lhan cig dge 'dun gnas brtan du gyur nas gnas brtan gnyis
analyzed: mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi don la ma song ba la ji ltar rgan rims nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan yod pa la btsun pa nye dgas rgan pa gzhan 'ongs pa la bdag nyid dang lhan cig dge 'dun gnas brtan du gyur nas gnas brtan gnyis
translated: This is like the case of Venerable Upāli, who, when an elder of the Sangha came while he was the elder, thought, “I will become an elder of the Sangha together with another elder who has come.”

analyzed: pas gnas par bya snyom pa'i blos gtsug lag khang gzhan du song ba na /

original: gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang sngar bstan pa'i gnas mal la ji ltar 'phel ba nyid kyis mal stan slong bar byed pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang sngar bstan pa'i gnas mal la ji ltar 'phel ba nyid kyis mal stan slong bar byed pa zhes bya ba /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba'i lung las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba'i lung las 'byung ba yin no //

analyzed: gzhan la ni ji ltar 'theb nyid las bsko bar bya'o zhes smos pa ste /

translated: It is not the dwelling itself. For this very reason, the text says “bedding and seats.”

original: gnas khang gi gzhir gyur pa'i gnas pa'i sgra 'di grags pa ste /
analyzed: gnas khang gi gzhir gyur pa'i gnas pa'i sgra 'di grags pa ste /
translated: The term “dwelling” is well known to refer to the ground of a dwelling.

original: de'i phyir shing ljon pa'i rtsa ba la sogs pa la 'dis cho ga 'di la byas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shing ljon pa'i rtsa ba la sogs pa la 'dis cho ga 'di la byas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this rule does not apply to the roots of a tree, etc.

original: nad pa 'dug pa'i gnas khang gzhan la mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni gnas khang zhes smos pas ni khri la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: nad pa 'dug pa'i gnas khang gzhan la mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni gnas khang zhes smos pas ni khri la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: “Do not give another dwelling to a sick monk” is stated to exclude a bed, etc.

original: de nyid thob pa med na mi sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid thob pa med na mi sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Do not give it unless he is entitled to it.”

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni de lhag par gnas pa nyid la thob pa la ji ltar rgyan rims su ma byas par nad pa la gnas khang sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni de lhag par gnas pa nyid la thob pa la ji ltar rgyan rims su ma byas par nad pa la gnas khang sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: “It” refers to the dwelling. If he is not entitled to it, a dwelling should not be given to a sick monk, even if he is the most senior.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text reads:

original: dge slong nad pa'i gnas khang gzhan la bsko bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong nad pa'i gnas khang gzhan la bsko bar mi bya'o //
translated: “A monk should not assign another dwelling to a sick monk.

original: bsko na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsko na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does, he commits an offense.”

original: 'dir nad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor mi bzod pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir nad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor mi bzod pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, one who is sick should be understood as one who is unable to work.

original: de lta bas na nad pa sbyor mi bzod pa zhes bya ba de las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nad pa sbyor mi bzod pa zhes bya ba de las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who is sick and unable to work should be understood in this way.

original: de dang de'i g-yog las byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba la /🔽de zhes bya ba ni nad pa de'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i g-yog las byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba la / de zhes bya ba ni nad pa de'o //
translated: He should not be made to work as an attendant.🔽He means the sick person.

original: de'i zhes bya ba de ni nad pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba de ni nad pa de'i 'o //
translated: His means the sick person’s.

original: mdze can gyis dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gos kyi gzhi las de dang por bya ste /
analyzed: mdze can gyis dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gos kyi gzhi las de dang por bya ste /
translated: A leper should not use the bedding of the Saṅgha. This is the first topic in the chapter on robes.

original: nad g-yog sbyin pas 'di la snying brtse bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog sbyin pas 'di la snying brtse bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: He should be shown compassion with the gift of nursing. This is the final topic.

original: de la gnas dben pa sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnas dben pa sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: A secluded place should be given to him.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mdze can la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mdze can la'o //
translated: To him means to the leper.

original: 'dir gnas dben pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnas dben pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'o //
translated: Here, a secluded place is one that is desired by others.

original: de las tha dad par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las tha dad par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It should not be understood as separate from that.

original: dben par de nyid kyis gang zhig sba ba nyid de 'dir rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dben par de nyid kyis gang zhig sba ba nyid de 'dir rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that it is just that which is to be concealed in solitude.

original: dge 'dun gyis bsten par bya ba dang bcas pa tha na khyams dang / khyams gru bzhi dang / sgo khang dang / bang rim dang / 'chags dang / shing drung gi gnas der yang 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bsten par bya ba dang bcas pa tha na khyams dang / khyams gru bzhi dang / sgo khang dang / bang rim dang / 'chags dang / shing drung gi gnas der yang 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not stay even in a courtyard, a square, a gateway, a terrace, an open area, or a place under a tree, where the Saṅgha is to be served.

original: bsten pa zhes bya ba ni bsten pa yod par gyur pa la dus dus su bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsten pa zhes bya ba ni bsten pa yod par gyur pa la dus dus su bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term to be served means that one should serve from time to time in a place where service is to be done.

original: gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: By whom?

original: dge 'dun gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro /
translated: The term by the Saṅgha is supplied.

original: rab tu byung ba zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand ordained person.

original: gnas pas kun nas longs spyad pa ni bstan pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pas kun nas longs spyad pa ni bstan pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The term to be served is used to refer to the enjoyment of the dwelling place.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs gnyis su 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dag @96a * //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs gnyis su 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dag @96a * //
translated: One should not enter the two shelters for defecation and urination.

original: gis zhes bya ba 'jug go //
analyzed: gis zhes bya ba 'jug go //
translated: The term by the Saṅgha is supplied.

original: de la g-yog bsko bas snying brtse bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad yun ring zhing che ba yin pa'i phyir nad g-yog de med na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de la g-yog bsko bas snying brtse bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad yun ring zhing che ba yin pa'i phyir nad g-yog de med na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba /
translated: One should appoint attendants to care for him with affection. This means that if the attendant is not available, one should give to another.

original: cho ga 'di la 'dir ma sbyar ba gang yin pa'i brda de la de'i dogs pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di la 'dir ma sbyar ba gang yin pa'i brda de la de'i dogs pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The term here refers to the absence of this procedure in the present text, and the purpose is to dispel doubt about that.

original: dus thams cad du dgon pa dag la lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa'i phyir gnas khang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus thams cad du dgon pa dag la lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa'i phyir gnas khang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should appoint a dwelling for the sake of storing the alms-bowl and robes in the wilderness at all times.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is as follows:

original: dge slong dgon pa dag dang gtsug lag khang du lhags te /
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa dag dang gtsug lag khang du lhags te /
translated: Monks who have come to the wilderness and to the monastery,

original: gnas khang dag rnyed pa na dge slong dag las ma thob nas /
analyzed: gnas khang dag rnyed pa na dge slong dag las ma thob nas /
translated: having obtained dwellings, if they do not obtain them from the monks,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: gtsug lag khang du dge slong dgon pa pa rnams kyi lhung bzed dang / chos gos gang du 'jog pa'i gnas khang bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du dge slong dgon pa pa rnams kyi lhung bzed dang / chos gos gang du 'jog pa'i gnas khang bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: One should appoint a dwelling for the sake of storing the alms-bowl and robes of the monks in the wilderness in the monastery.

original: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dbyar dag nyi tshor ma zad kyi gang zhig 'dir smos pa'i gzhung las dus kyi khyad par la ma bsten pa de bas na mdo'i tshig 'di smos te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dbyar dag nyi tshor ma zad kyi gang zhig 'dir smos pa'i gzhung las dus kyi khyad par la ma bsten pa de bas na mdo'i tshig 'di smos te /
translated: At all times means that in the rainy season, when the days are long, one should not rely on a special time for the rules that are mentioned here. Therefore, the words of the sutra are stated.

original: de'i phyir dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa na kha cig glo bur du 'ong srid pas gnas dang gnas mal gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa na kha cig glo bur du 'ong srid pas gnas dang gnas mal gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, when one undertakes the rainy season retreat, one should set aside a dwelling and bedding, because it is possible that some will come unexpectedly.

original: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba 'di la rjes su 'jug pa med par bstan pa'i don du ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba 'di la rjes su 'jug pa med par bstan pa'i don du ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase at all times is taught to be without exception.

original: bye brag yang yongs su ma smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag yang yongs su ma smos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the exceptions are not fully stated,

original: khas blangs pa gnyis ka la yang snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khas blangs pa gnyis ka la yang snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: both the earlier and later should be understood in both cases.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi gzhi'o //
translated: Dwelling means the basis of the dwelling.

original: mang po dag lhags na gnas pa gang gis gzong bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong glo bur pa mang po dag lhags na sngar gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis gnas mal gzod bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: mang po dag lhags na gnas pa gang gis gzong bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong glo bur pa mang po dag lhags na sngar gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis gnas mal gzod bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If many guest monks arrive, the resident monks who have previously agreed to stay should draw lots to determine who will give up their sleeping place.🔽But they should not do this after they have agreed to stay.

original: gnas par khas blangs pa phyin chad mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni slar bsko ba gnyis pa la khas blangs pa phyi ma shos gang yin pa zhes bya ba de las yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par khas blangs pa phyin chad mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni slar bsko ba gnyis pa la khas blangs pa phyi ma shos gang yin pa zhes bya ba de las yid ches pa'o //
translated: The second drawing of lots is the one that is agreed upon later.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The text here is from the Vinaya:

original: dge slong dag pas dge slong ma 'ongs pa rnams la bsten nas dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa gnyis pa bcas kyi gsum pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag pas dge slong ma 'ongs pa rnams la bsten nas dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa gnyis pa bcas kyi gsum pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Monks, you should not agree to stay for the rainy season after relying on nuns who have not arrived.

original: mang ba nyid yin na gcig la yang gnyis la sogs pa khyab pa'i bar dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mang ba nyid yin na gcig la yang gnyis la sogs pa khyab pa'i bar dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: If there are many, even one should give up their sleeping place to two or more.

original: gnyis la sogs pa zhes @96b bya ba ni gnas kyi gzhi la sogs pa nas tha ma bstan par byed de mang ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis la sogs pa zhes @96b bya ba ni gnas kyi gzhi la sogs pa nas tha ma bstan par byed de mang ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Two or more” means that the last is taught from the basis of the location, etc.

original: bsko bar bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsko bar bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: “If there are many” means that they should be assigned.

original: sa de snyed du mang ba'i gzhi dag la re re la bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa de snyed du mang ba'i gzhi dag la re re la bsko bar bya'o //
translated: The basis of the many, up to that number of levels, should be assigned one by one.

original: ji snyed pa bsko ba rnams la thams cad kyi bsko ba 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji snyed pa bsko ba rnams la thams cad kyi bsko ba 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the assignment of all is accomplished for as many as are assigned.

original: zhag gcig gi don du gnas mal mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhag gcig gi don du gnas mal mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not take up a bedding for the sake of one day.

original: gnas mal zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de gtsug lag khang la sogs pa yang gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas mal zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de gtsug lag khang la sogs pa yang gnas pa yin no //
translated: The mention of “bedding” is just an example; the monastery, etc. are also a dwelling.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: phran tshegs dag las /
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las /
translated: In the Ksudraka Collection,

original: dge slong gis zhag gcig gi don du gnas mal mnod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis zhag gcig gi don du gnas mal mnod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it says, “A monk should not take up bedding for the sake of one day.”

original: rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang mi mnod do zhes bya ba ni gnas mal la yang 'phangs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang mi mnod do zhes bya ba ni gnas mal la yang 'phangs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: “One should not accept a monastery out of desire for gain.” This also applies to bedding.

original: 'dir gzhung ni //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni //
translated: Here is the text:

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na dge slong rnams la rgan rims bzhin du gnas mal stobs par byed na /
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na dge slong rnams la rgan rims bzhin du gnas mal stobs par byed na /
translated: “Then at another time, when the monks were distributing bedding according to seniority,

original: bram ze zhig gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas des de mthong ba dang / gang gi phyir 'di bzhin bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can sh'akya'i sras kyi dge slong 'di dag la su zhig mngon par dad par mi 'gyur snyam du dad pa skyes par gyur nas /
analyzed: bram ze zhig gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas des de mthong ba dang / gang gi phyir 'di bzhin bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngang tshul can sh'akya'i sras kyi dge slong 'di dag la su zhig mngon par dad par mi 'gyur snyam du dad pa skyes par gyur nas /
translated: a brahmin came to the monastery. When he saw that, he thought, ‘For what reason do these monks, sons of the Śākya, who are of such a nature as to distribute equally, distribute bedding according to seniority? Who would not have faith in them?’ Faith arose in him,

original: des gtsug lag khang byed du bcug ste dge slong gi dge 'dun la phul ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: des gtsug lag khang byed du bcug ste dge slong gi dge 'dun la phul ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: and he had a monastery built and offered it to the saṅgha of monks. The monks said,

original: ha cang gsher ches so zhes mi len pa dang / des phrus 'debs su bcug ste phul lo //
analyzed: ha cang gsher ches so zhes mi len pa dang / des phrus 'debs su bcug ste phul lo //
translated: ‘It is too wet.’ They did not accept it. He had it filled with earth and offered it again.

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,🔽‘It is too high.’

original: ha cang dgon dung ches so zhes mi len pa dang / bram ze des de dag rnyed pa 'dod pas mi len par rig nas /
analyzed: ha cang dgon dung ches so zhes mi len pa dang / bram ze des de dag rnyed pa 'dod pas mi len par rig nas /
translated: The brahmin thought, They do not accept because they are too holy, and he thought, They do not accept because they desire gain.

original: bram ze des sh'akya'i sras kyi dge slong dag gis rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang len to zhes bya bar rtsom pa nas /
analyzed: bram ze des sh'akya'i sras kyi dge slong dag gis rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang len to zhes bya bar rtsom pa nas /
translated: The brahmin began, The śramaṇas, sons of the Śākyas, do not accept the monastery because they desire gain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa 'dod pas gtsug lag khang blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Monks should not accept a monastery because they desire gain.

original: 'on kyang sbyin bdag rnams la rjes su snying brtse bas gtsug lag khang rnams blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyin bdag rnams la rjes su snying brtse bas gtsug lag khang rnams blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: However, they should accept monasteries out of compassion for the benefactors.🔽This is included in that statement.

original: de lta bas na 'dir brtse ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshon pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin te de bas na 'di bsdu bar ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir brtse ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshon pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin te de bas na 'di bsdu bar ma byas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, with a compassionate mind here is merely an illustration, so it is not included.

original: thams @97a * //
analyzed: thams @97a * //
translated: All

original: cad yongs su spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang du ma blangs pa'o //
analyzed: cad yongs su spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang du ma blangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase all of it is to be used means that it is not to be taken into the monastery.

original: 'di la ji ltar thams cad kun nas spyad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar thams cad kun nas spyad par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that all of it is to be used?

original: de'i phyir la lar klog pa dang / kha ton dang / 'dug pa dang / bcag pa las gang yang rung ba bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir la lar klog pa dang / kha ton dang / 'dug pa dang / bcag pa las gang yang rung ba bya /
translated: Therefore, it is said, In some places, one should do whatever is appropriate: reading, reciting, sitting, or walking.

original: la lar lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: la lar lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In some places, one should put down one's alms bowl and Dharma robes.

original: la lar mtshan mo nyal ba dang / la lar snga dro dang / gung tshigs dang / phyi dro 'dug pas de la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: la lar mtshan mo nyal ba dang / la lar snga dro dang / gung tshigs dang / phyi dro 'dug pas de la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In some places, one should sleep at night, and in some places, one should sit in the morning, at noon, and in the evening. One should apply oneself to this.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni thams cad yongs su spyad par bya ba de la'o //🔽de la gzhung kha cig las ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni thams cad yongs su spyad par bya ba de la'o // de la gzhung kha cig las ni /
translated: The phrase in some places means in all of the places where one is to use everything.

original: la lar bklag par bya ;🔽kha don bya /
analyzed: la lar bklag par bya ; kha don bya /
translated: In some texts, it is said, In some places, one should read.🔽In some places, one should recite.

original: la lar lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag par bya /🔽la lar 'chag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽gzhung kha cig las ni /
analyzed: la lar lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag par bya / la lar 'chag par bya'o zhes gsungs so // gzhung kha cig las ni /
translated: In some places, one should put down one's alms bowl and Dharma robes.🔽In some places, one should walk.

original: la lar snga dro 'dug par bya /
analyzed: la lar snga dro 'dug par bya /
translated: In some texts, it is said, In some places, one should sit in the morning.

original: la lar gung tshigs la 'dug par bya /🔽la lar phyi dro 'dug par bya /
analyzed: la lar gung tshigs la 'dug par bya / la lar phyi dro 'dug par bya /
translated: Some should stay for the morning meal,🔽some for the afternoon,

original: la lar mtshan mo 'dug par bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: la lar mtshan mo 'dug par bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: some for the night.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka bsdu ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka bsdu ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: Therefore, this sūtra was composed in order to include both.

original: gnas par khas blangs pas gnas kyi gzhi ral ba dang 'drums pa bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas par khas blangs pas gnas kyi gzhi ral ba dang 'drums pa bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: By accepting the dwelling, the basis of the dwelling should be repaired if torn or broken.

original: ral ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig chad pa'o //
analyzed: ral ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig chad pa'o //
translated: Here, torn means a part is missing.

original: 'drums pa zhes bya ba ni gas pa'o //
analyzed: 'drums pa zhes bya ba ni gas pa'o //
translated: Broken means cracked.

original: dge slong ma dbyar gnas pa rnams kyis dbyar khang bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad du gcig tu gyur nas thams cad spyis bcos par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dge slong ma dbyar gnas pa rnams kyis dbyar khang bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad du gcig tu gyur nas thams cad spyis bcos par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The nuns who stay during the rainy season should repair the rainy season dwelling. This means that when all become one, all should repair it together.

original: gnas khang gang na gang gnas pa des de nyi tshes bcos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar cho ga 'di'o //
analyzed: gnas khang gang na gang gnas pa des de nyi tshes bcos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar cho ga 'di'o //
translated: It is not that whoever stays in which dwelling should repair it every day. This is the procedure.

original: de bas na ma byas ba nyid de la ral ba dang 'drums pa zhes bya ba 'dis rung ba 'jug pa sgrub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma byas ba nyid de la ral ba dang 'drums pa zhes bya ba 'dis rung ba 'jug pa sgrub pa'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who has not done it is called “bald” and “ruined” by this, for the purpose of establishing the engagement of what is proper.🔽The winter and summer resting places should be assigned for the purpose of not allowing the quarrelsome to obtain a place.

original: 'thab krol can gyis gnas mi thob par bya ba'i phyir dgun mnod pa dang dpyid mnod pa'i gnas mal yang bstab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba de la dgun dang so ga'i dus kyi cha dag la zla ba bzhi dang ldan pa nyid la
analyzed: 'thab krol can gyis gnas mi thob par bya ba'i phyir dgun mnod pa dang dpyid mnod pa'i gnas mal yang bstab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba de la dgun dang so ga'i dus kyi cha dag la zla ba bzhi dang ldan pa nyid la
translated: The one who is suitable for that should be assigned to the winter and summer resting places, having four months each,

original: mngon par brten nas tshig de smos so //
analyzed: mngon par brten nas tshig de smos so //
translated: and having relied on that, that word is stated.

original: ril gyis bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas mal ril gyis bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: ril gyis bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas mal ril gyis bsko bar bya'o //
translated: The entire should be assigned. The entire resting place should be assigned.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the purpose of teaching just that,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dag gi nyen kor yang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang khang khyim dag gi nyen kor yang ngo //
translated: The vicinity of the monastery and the houses.

original: khyams kyi de yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyen @97b kor dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyams kyi de yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyen @97b kor dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The courtyard and that also. The meaning of “together with the vicinity” is stated.

original: de dag dong ba nyid kyi 'og tu de dag mi gtong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag dong ba nyid kyi 'og tu de dag mi gtong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: After they have gone, they should not be prevented from leaving.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni khyams kyi nyan kor dang de'i nyan kor dus ma nges pa nyid kyis dgun dang dpyid mnod pa'i gnas mal gnyis kyang bstab par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni khyams kyi nyan kor dang de'i nyan kor dus ma nges pa nyid kyis dgun dang dpyid mnod pa'i gnas mal gnyis kyang bstab par bya'o //
translated: Those refers to the boundary of the monastery and its vicinity, and since the time of the boundary and its vicinity is not fixed, the two beds for the rainy season retreat in winter and spring should also be assigned.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir sgyu thabs mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du gnas pas 'thab krol mi byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni thams cad nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir sgyu thabs mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du gnas pas 'thab krol mi byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni thams cad nyid kyis te /
translated: Because they are naturally settled, there is no need for deceit.  Because they are naturally settled, they do not quarrel means all of them.

original: 'di ni bsko ba'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsko ba'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is not only at the time of appointment, means understanding without distinction.

original: gang zhig mtha' 'khob kyi ri la rang bzhin du gnas pa'i don du cho ga de la byas pas de'i don du de mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos pa de ni 'di'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mtha' 'khob kyi ri la rang bzhin du gnas pa'i don du cho ga de la byas pas de'i don du de mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos pa de ni 'di'o //
translated: Since the purpose of the natural settlement of those on the border mountains is accomplished by that ritual, it is said that it should not be done for that purpose. That is this.

original: 'byung ba'i don du ni mi bsko'o zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don du dgos pa nye bar mi gnas pas de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i don du ni mi bsko'o zhes bya ba ni phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don du dgos pa nye bar mi gnas pas de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not to be circumambulated for the sake of future events.

original: 'di ni dus tshigs dang / nyin mtshan dang de'i yan lag che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dus tshigs dang / nyin mtshan dang de'i yan lag che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o //
translated: This is the time, day and night, and part of it, for such and such an event.

original: 'di ni mkhan po dang slob dpon che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mkhan po dang slob dpon che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o //
translated: This is for the sake of such and such an abbot and preceptor.

original: 'di ni lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o //
translated: This is for the sake of such and such a co-resident and pupil.

original: 'di ni gtam 'dres pa dang phebs par smra ba dang / 'grogs bshes dang smos 'drin pa la sogs pa che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o zhes gtsug lag khang dag bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni gtam 'dres pa dang phebs par smra ba dang / 'grogs bshes dang smos 'drin pa la sogs pa che ge mo zhig 'byung ba'i'o zhes gtsug lag khang dag bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is for the sake of such and such a conversation, intimacy, companionship, friendship, and so on.

original: de'i yan lag ces bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi yan lag snga dro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yan lag ces bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi yan lag snga dro la sogs pa'o //
translated: The part of it refers to the parts of day and night, such as the morning.

original: mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not to be circumambulated.

original: gzhan gyis bskos kyang mnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskos kyang mnod par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if appointed by others, it is not to be circumambulated.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'byung ba'i don du gtsug lag khang bsko bar mi bya /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'byung ba'i don du gtsug lag khang bsko bar mi bya /
translated: Here the treatise declares, “Do not assign a temple for the purpose of a monastery.

original: bskor gzhug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bskor gzhug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Do not assign a monastery for the purpose of a temple.”

original: de la mdo snga mas ni bsko bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa bsdus so //
analyzed: de la mdo snga mas ni bsko bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa bsdus so //
translated: The first passage means, “Do not assign a monastery.”

original: mdo 'dis ni bskor gzhug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa bsdus so //
analyzed: mdo 'dis ni bskor gzhug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa bsdus so //
translated: The second passage means, “Do not assign a temple.”

original: phran tshegs dag las kyang dge 'dun gyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba dang por byas te mnod pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las kyang dge 'dun gyi 'brel pa zhes bya ba dang por byas te mnod pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The Ksudraka Collection also says, “First, the Sangha should assign a monastery.

original: tshang gzhig pa'i phyir dbyu gu thogs pa bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshang gzhig pa'i phyir dbyu gu thogs pa bsko bar bya'o //
translated: In order to destroy the nests, assign a person with a stick.

original: sgo nga med pa rnams ni gdon par bya'o //🔽phra mo rnams kyi ni mi 'phel par bya ba'i phyir skud pas dkri'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgo nga med pa rnams ni gdon par bya'o // phra mo rnams kyi ni mi 'phel par bya ba'i phyir skud pas dkri'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those without eggs should be removed.

original: khva ta dang mchil @98a * //
analyzed: khva ta dang mchil @98a * //
translated: In order to prevent the growth of the small ones, they should be wrapped with string.”🔽This does not apply to crows,

original: pa dang phug ron rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa dang phug ron rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: swans, or pigeons.

original: 'on te 'on kyang phra mo chung ba sbrang bu tree ma bu ga dang tree la ta la sogs pa dag gi tshang gang yin pa de rnams skud pas dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'on kyang phra mo chung ba sbrang bu tree ma bu ga dang tree la ta la sogs pa dag gi tshang gang yin pa de rnams skud pas dkri bar bya'o //
translated: But if they are small and fragile, like the nests of bees, of the treemant bird, etc., they should be bound together with thread.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mi 'brel bar bya ba'i phyir skud pas dkri'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mi 'brel bar bya ba'i phyir skud pas dkri'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here the text says “bound together with thread” in order to make the meaning clear.

original: dkris pa de la 'di rnams kyang brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dkris pa de la 'di rnams kyang brjod pa yin te /
translated: And this is said with regard to that binding together:

original: nye bar bsags par bya zhes bya ba don 'di shes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsags par bya zhes bya ba don 'di shes pa'o //
translated: “They should be stored” means that one should understand this meaning.

original: gnas mal la sogs pa sbyin no zhes bya ba gos la sogs pa yang bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: gnas mal la sogs pa sbyin no zhes bya ba gos la sogs pa yang bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: “Beds, etc.” means that one should also give clothing, etc. The word “etc.” is used to include these.

original: yod pa nyid na du ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gal te gnyis pa khri'u'i rim pa yod par gyur na khri'u la sogs pa gsum la sogs pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid na du ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gal te gnyis pa khri'u'i rim pa yod par gyur na khri'u la sogs pa gsum la sogs pa yang rung ste /
translated: “If they exist, many also” means that if there are two or more tiers of beds, then three or more beds, etc.,

original: de yang sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: are also to be given. This is the meaning.

original: rim pa yongs su ma rdzogs na rgan rims nas brtsams te ji tsam khyed pa yan chad la de snyed pa rnams la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don gyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa yongs su ma rdzogs na rgan rims nas brtsams te ji tsam khyed pa yan chad la de snyed pa rnams la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don gyis shes par bya'o //
translated: If the sequence is not complete, one should give to as many as one can afford, starting from the oldest.

original: khri chen po dag kyang bsko bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: khri chen po dag kyang bsko bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The great thrones should also be appointed.

original: stan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi dag las de'o //
analyzed: stan dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi dag las de'o //
translated: And the seats, as stated in the nidana.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal g-yogs pa dge tshul mi gtsang bas nyams par byed pa'i chos can la sus kyang mi sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal g-yogs pa dge tshul mi gtsang bas nyams par byed pa'i chos can la sus kyang mi sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bedding of the Sangha should not be given to any novice who is defiled by impurity.

original: sus kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas mal stobs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan dag gis kyang sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sus kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas mal stobs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan dag gis kyang sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word any means that it should not be given by anyone else, not only by the one who distributes the bedding.

original: dge slong ma la yang mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni gnas mal gyi chos can la dge 'dun gyi gnas mal g-yogs pa dag mi gtsang ba la sus kyang mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma la yang mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni gnas mal gyi chos can la dge 'dun gyi gnas mal g-yogs pa dag mi gtsang ba la sus kyang mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: It should not be given to any nun either. The bedding of the Sangha should not be given to any novice who is defiled by impurity.

original: dge slong ma rnams la 'brel pa'i khri sbyin par mi bya'o zhes 'dir smos te /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la 'brel pa'i khri sbyin par mi bya'o zhes 'dir smos te /
translated: “Do not give a bed to nuns.”

original: gnas mal yang zhes bya ba 'dir yang cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas mal yang zhes bya ba 'dir yang cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Also bedding” means that this procedure is also established here.

original: 'dir gnas 'byor na de la 'dab tu gtsug lag khang sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir gnas 'byor na de la 'dab tu gtsug lag khang sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: “If there is a vacancy, give a temple to them.”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'o //
translated: “To them” means to nuns.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la'o //
translated: “Here” means in a temple.

original: gnas mal lhag pa bzang po ma yin pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas mal lhag pa bzang po ma yin pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Also bedding that is not excellent.”

original: lhag ces bya ba ni dge slong rnams las lhag par gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: lhag ces bya ba ni dge slong rnams las lhag par gnas pa la'o //
translated: “Also” means that it is not only the temple.

original: khyed cag la gang gis kyang dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la gding ba med par longs spyad par mi bya /🔽gding ba rung ba @98b ma yin pas longs spyad par mi bya /
analyzed: khyed cag la gang gis kyang dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la gding ba med par longs spyad par mi bya / gding ba rung ba @98b ma yin pas longs spyad par mi bya /
translated: “No one should use the bedding of the Saṅgha without a covering.”🔽“Do not use bedding that is not suitable.”

original: gding ba dri ma can gyis longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gding ba dri ma can gyis longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Do not use bedding that is soiled.”

original: de ni ltung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni ltung ba yin te /
translated: This is the downfall.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi nyid las 'dir yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi nyid las 'dir yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the bases of training are present here.

original: zla ba phyed cing so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas mal la'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed cing so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas mal la'o //
translated: Every half month, one should examine. This refers to bedding.

original: dam tshig las 'das shing spyad na gnas pa ni gnas la gzhan gyi ni dge 'dun la brjod de dbrog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brten pa las gzhan dge 'dun la zhus te spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig las 'das shing spyad na gnas pa ni gnas la gzhan gyi ni dge 'dun la brjod de dbrog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brten pa las gzhan dge 'dun la zhus te spyad par bya'o //
translated: If one transgresses the rule and uses it, the resident monk should announce it to the Saṅgha and take it back. This means that one should use it after requesting the Saṅgha, other than the resident monks.

original: dge 'dun song sbyin bdag che ge mo dang zhal ta ba che ge mo dang / spyod yul gyi gnas che ge mo dang nad g-yog che ge mos gnas par zhal gyis bzhes par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun song sbyin bdag che ge mo dang zhal ta ba che ge mo dang / spyod yul gyi gnas che ge mo dang nad g-yog che ge mos gnas par zhal gyis bzhes par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, “The Saṅgha has accepted the use of the bedding of so-and-so, the donor, so-and-so, the attendant, so-and-so, the place for wandering, and so-and-so, the nurse.”

original: 'gyod pa dang / gzhan sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba mi skyed pa nyid dang / sel ba nyid dag dang / bde ba dang yid mi bde ba bskyed pa nyid rjes su bsrung ba nyid dag dang / nad g-yog nyid tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag las 'byung ba so sor brtags pas gnas dang spyod yul dang /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang / gzhan sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba mi skyed pa nyid dang / sel ba nyid dag dang / bde ba dang yid mi bde ba bskyed pa nyid rjes su bsrung ba nyid dag dang / nad g-yog nyid tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag las 'byung ba so sor brtags pas gnas dang spyod yul dang /
translated: and the absence of regret, the absence of the suffering of others, and the absence of mental dissatisfaction, and the absence of the generation of pleasure and mental satisfaction, and the absence of the protection of those who are ill, and the absence of the service of those who are of the same conduct as oneself.

original: bsod snyoms dang sman par byed pa la rnam par bltas te gnas par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pas nye bar gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms dang sman par byed pa la rnam par bltas te gnas par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pas nye bar gnas pa la'o //
translated: One should live by looking at the place, the domain, the alms, and the doctor, after having examined them.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal ni shin tu che ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal ni shin tu che ba ste /
translated: Here, suffering is very great,

original: yid mi bde ba dang yid bde ba ni bde ba shin tu che ba ste lus kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang yid bde ba ni bde ba shin tu che ba ste lus kyi yang ngo //
translated: and mental dissatisfaction and mental satisfaction are very great pleasure, and also bodily.

original: de'i lus can gyi yul bsdus pa dang / de'i rigs can bza' bar bya ba sbyin pa ni de dag gis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba ni gso bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lus can gyi yul bsdus pa dang / de'i rigs can bza' bar bya ba sbyin pa ni de dag gis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba ni gso bar byed pa'o //
translated: The collection of objects that are its body, and the food that is of its type, are the doctor, because they remove the suffering that is generated by them.

original: bde ba rjes su srung ba ni de'i tshogs pa rnams la ji ltar mi 'bral ba de ni de ltar kun thub pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba rjes su srung ba ni de'i tshogs pa rnams la ji ltar mi 'bral ba de ni de ltar kun thub pa'o //
translated: The protection of happiness is the protection of the assembly of monks, so that they do not separate from him.

original: sbyin par byed pa la zhes bya ba ni spyod yul de la 'byor pa so sor brtags pas so //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa la zhes bya ba ni spyod yul de la 'byor pa so sor brtags pas so //
translated: The examination of the place is the examination of the place of practice.

original: gang du gnas par khas blang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gnas par khas blang bar bya zhe na /
translated: Where should one accept the retreat?

original: de'i phyir g-yogs par dge slong gi mdun du'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yogs par dge slong gi mdun du'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, in front of the monks, in a covered place.

original: gtsug lag khang du mar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du mar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not to be done in the monastery.

original: gtsug lag khang du mar mtshams su rdzas gcig gis mnan te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du mar mtshams su rdzas gcig gis mnan te /
translated: In the monastery, the boundary is covered by one substance,

original: du mas khas len pa gang yin pa der yang 'di dag bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: du mas khas len pa gang yin pa der yang 'di dag bkag pa yin no //
translated: but it is accepted by many. This is also prohibited there.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis gtsug lag khang gnyis su dbyar gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis gtsug lag khang gnyis su dbyar gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the text says, A monk should not accept the retreat in two monasteries.

original: khas len par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khas len par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he accepts it, he becomes guilty of an offense.

original: gang la dge slong med pa nyid dang sgo @99a * //
analyzed: gang la dge slong med pa nyid dang sgo @99a * //
translated: Where there are no monks at all, and the door

original: glegs med pa nyid dang bcas par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: glegs med pa nyid dang bcas par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: And one should not be without a scripture.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la'o //
translated: In which means in the monastery.

original: gtsug lag khang gang na 'di gnyi ga mnyam par sbyor ba de yang gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gang na 'di gnyi ga mnyam par sbyor ba de yang gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not accept to live in a monastery where both of these are not practiced equally.

original: sbyin bdag dang zhal ta ba dang spyod yul gyi grong dang nad g-yog dag yod pa nyid yin na brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te de na de dag yod pa nyid na khas len pa'i sngags brjod pa'i tshe yang de skad brjod par bya ste
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang zhal ta ba dang spyod yul gyi grong dang nad g-yog dag yod pa nyid yin na brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te de na de dag yod pa nyid na khas len pa'i sngags brjod pa'i tshe yang de skad brjod par bya ste
translated: If there are benefactors, administrators, villages in the sphere of activity, and nurses, one should say. The meaning is that if they are present there, one should say so when reciting the formula of acceptance.

original: / zhu ba las kyang brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / zhu ba las kyang brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should also say it when asked.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs par mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'char bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni skya rengs las dus sngar mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'da' bar byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'char bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni skya rengs las dus sngar mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'da' bar byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: One should not let dawn break outside the boundary without permission. The meaning is that there is no offense in going outside the boundary before dawn.

original: de lta yang gal te 'gro na de yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yang gal te 'gro na de yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if he does go, he should not stay there.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i don du zhag bdun byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos las mi 'da' ba'i don la'o //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i don du zhag bdun byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos las mi 'da' ba'i don la'o //
translated: He should be empowered for seven days for a Dharma purpose, that is, for the purpose of not transgressing the Dharma.

original: de 'dir rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'dir rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Here it is explained in detail.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dge slong gi kun dga' ra ba 'bul ba dang / gtsug lag khang zhal bsro ba dang / gnas mal 'bul ba dang / bslab pa brtan po bca' ba dang / mchod rten zhal bsro ba dang / mchod sdong gzugs pa dang / rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dge slong gi kun dga' ra ba 'bul ba dang / gtsug lag khang zhal bsro ba dang / gnas mal 'bul ba dang / bslab pa brtan po bca' ba dang / mchod rten zhal bsro ba dang / mchod sdong gzugs pa dang / rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang /
translated: It is like this:🔽offering a monastery, consecrating a temple, offering bedding, establishing firm training rules, consecrating a stūpa, erecting a statue, raising a victory banner,

original: mchod pa bya ba dang / tshon dang / tsan dan gur kum byug pa skud pa dang / bklag pa dang / 'gyod pa bsal ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa spang ba dang / phyogs dang mthun pa bsgrub pa dang / bzod pa gsol ba dang /
analyzed: mchod pa bya ba dang / tshon dang / tsan dan gur kum byug pa skud pa dang / bklag pa dang / 'gyod pa bsal ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa spang ba dang / phyogs dang mthun pa bsgrub pa dang / bzod pa gsol ba dang /
translated: making offerings, anointing with colors, sandalwood, and saffron, reciting, confessing, abandoning views, establishing harmony, requesting forgiveness,

original: yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa bzhi bya ba dang / dbyung ba dang nad pa dbugs dbyung ba dag la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa bzhi bya ba dang / dbyung ba dang nad pa dbugs dbyung ba dag la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The four actions of fully ordaining and so on are:🔽fully ordaining,🔽initiating,🔽giving full ordination, and🔽giving novice ordination.

original: mchod sdong gzugs pa dang rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchod sdong gzugs pa dang rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Erecting a victory banner and a shrine means:

original: mchod sdong gi sgras ni gzugs ba dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: mchod sdong gi sgras ni gzugs ba dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The term shrine is related to erecting.🔽Reading means reading the title of a sutra and teaching it.

original: bklag pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i mtshan bklag pa dang / ston pa na rnyed pa 'grub pa yod pas longs spyad pa'i don du zhes bya ba 'dir smos te /
analyzed: bklag pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i mtshan bklag pa dang / ston pa na rnyed pa 'grub pa yod pas longs spyad pa'i don du zhes bya ba 'dir smos te /
translated: Since one obtains gain by doing that, it is said that one should enjoy it.

original: klog pa de tsam gyi phyir yang rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: klog pa de tsam gyi phyir yang rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is proper to read just that much.

original: bzod pa gsol ba zhes bya ba yang bsdu ba'i phyir bklag pa zhes bya ba'i sgras smos so //
analyzed: bzod pa gsol ba zhes bya ba yang bsdu ba'i phyir bklag pa zhes bya ba'i sgras smos so //
translated: Also, requesting forbearance is included in reading, so it is mentioned by the term reading.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba @99b ni smon lam gyi lam bya ba dang / gzhi 'ga' zhig so sor gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba @99b ni smon lam gyi lam bya ba dang / gzhi 'ga' zhig so sor gnas pa la'o //
translated: In accord with the direction means in the path of aspiration and in some basis that is established.

original: yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa bzhi bya ba ni spo ba dang / gzhi nas yongs su spo ba dang / mgu bar bya ba dang / gzhi nas mgu bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa bzhi bya ba ni spo ba dang / gzhi nas yongs su spo ba dang / mgu bar bya ba dang / gzhi nas mgu bar bya ba'o //
translated: The four actions of complete rehabilitation, etc. are: rehabilitation, complete rehabilitation, reconciliation, and complete reconciliation.

original: gzhi nas mgu bar bya ba las tha mi dad do //
analyzed: gzhi nas mgu bar bya ba las tha mi dad do //
translated: Complete reconciliation is not different from reconciliation.

original: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos las mi 'da' ba'i don la zhes bya ba de dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos las mi 'da' ba'i don la zhes bya ba de dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The monk means that the meaning of not transgressing the Dharma is related to that.

original: dge slong ma'i lci ba'i chos kyi mgu bar bya ba dbul ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i lci ba'i chos kyi mgu bar bya ba dbul ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reconciliation of the heavy rules of the nuns is also to be offered, it is said.

original: snga ma rnams bsdu ba'i don du yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras smos so //🔽dge slong ma'i tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la yang ngo //🔽dge tshul gyi de la'o zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma rnams bsdu ba'i don du yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras smos so // dge slong ma'i tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la yang ngo // dge tshul gyi de la'o zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word also is used to include the previous ones.🔽The ordination of the nuns who abide in pure conduct is also to be offered, it is said.🔽The novice monk's ordination is also to be offered, it is said.

original: dge tshul ma'i bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa la'o //
analyzed: dge tshul ma'i bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa la'o //
translated: The novice nun's training vows are to be given, it is said.

original: khyim bdag dang khyim pa mo'i mgo dkri ba dang / bang bsang ba dang / skra bskyed pa dang / skra breg pa dang / gdub kor bskyed pa dag la'o zhes bya ba ni chos las mi 'da' ba'i don la zhag bdun man chad byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'dir thams cad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag dang khyim pa mo'i mgo dkri ba dang / bang bsang ba dang / skra bskyed pa dang / skra breg pa dang / gdub kor bskyed pa dag la'o zhes bya ba ni chos las mi 'da' ba'i don la zhag bdun man chad byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'dir thams cad du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of not transgressing the Dharma is to be understood in all cases here as the seven-day consecration.🔽Also, in the previous cases, except for the case of the Saṅgha-disapproved offenses of those who are not fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun lhag ma'i skabs ma gtogs pa snga ma dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa dbyung ba ma gtogs pa gang zhig sngon du kun dga' ra ba 'bul ba zhes bya ba la
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyi dge 'dun lhag ma'i skabs ma gtogs pa snga ma dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yongs su gnas pa la sogs pa dbyung ba ma gtogs pa gang zhig sngon du kun dga' ra ba 'bul ba zhes bya ba la
translated: The consecration, etc., except for the expulsion, which was previously stated as “first offering the monastery,” etc.,

original: sogs pa gsungs pa de thams cad bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs pa de thams cad bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: all of that should be understood for those who are not fully ordained.

original: khyim pa dang khyim pa mo'i bzod pa gsol ba ni kha bsrang pa'o zhes bya ba ni bzod par gsol ba'i gnas la khyim pa pho mo'i lhung bzed kha phub pa dag la kha bsrang bar gsol ba yin par blta'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang khyim pa mo'i bzod pa gsol ba ni kha bsrang pa'o zhes bya ba ni bzod par gsol ba'i gnas la khyim pa pho mo'i lhung bzed kha phub pa dag la kha bsrang bar gsol ba yin par blta'o //
translated: The phrase the patience of householders and laywomen is to be requested means that one should request the patience of householders and laywomen who have overturned their alms bowls.

original: zas dang sman dang g-yog dag med la de dag med par 'tsho mi nus na de las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zas dang sman dang g-yog dag med la de dag med par 'tsho mi nus na de las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If there is no food, medicine, or attendants, and one is unable to live without them, one should transgress that rule.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs ba de'o ;
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs ba de'o ;
translated: The phrase that refers to the vow to remain in retreat during the rainy season.

original: / zas la sogs pa rnams med la de dag med par 'tsho ma nus par gyur na de las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / zas la sogs pa rnams med la de dag med par 'tsho ma nus par gyur na de las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase if there is no food, etc. means that if one is unable to live without them, one should transgress that rule.

original: ji ltar zas med par 'tsho bar mi nus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar zas med par 'tsho bar mi nus she na /
translated: How is it that one is unable to live without food?

original: gang gi phyir 'dir yang bye brag tu 'di rten ni bye brag tu 'di la brten pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir yang bye brag tu 'di rten ni bye brag tu 'di la brten pa yod pa ste /
translated: Because in this case, the basis of the rule is the one who depends on it.

original: thams cad du med pa kho na ma @100a * //
analyzed: thams cad du med pa kho na ma @100a * //
translated: It does not exist everywhere.

original: yin te / de la mchog med pa la rtsa ba dang 'bras bu la sogs pa gzhan gyis su zhig la nus pa yod snyam du sems pa de bas 'di bye brag tu byas so //
analyzed: yin te / de la mchog med pa la rtsa ba dang 'bras bu la sogs pa gzhan gyis su zhig la nus pa yod snyam du sems pa de bas 'di bye brag tu byas so //
translated: For, in that case, who would think that the root, fruit, etc. have the power to produce the supreme?

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul dang srog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if there is an obstacle to the way of virtuous endeavor, to life, or to pure conduct.

original: de las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should transgress that.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning gi mtshan ma rnams sam /
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning gi mtshan ma rnams sam /
translated: The signs of a woman, man, or eunuch,

original: der gnyen 'dun rnams kyi bar chad yod na zhes bya ba de bsdus pa yin no //🔽dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba rjes su mi mthun pa'i sems bskyed pa dang sdig pa can gyi tshig brjod pa dag 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'i phyir rjes su mi mthun par gyur ba gnyis po de gang yin pa de la de skad ces
analyzed: der gnyen 'dun rnams kyi bar chad yod na zhes bya ba de bsdus pa yin no // dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba rjes su mi mthun pa'i sems bskyed pa dang sdig pa can gyi tshig brjod pa dag 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'i phyir rjes su mi mthun par gyur ba gnyis po de gang yin pa de la de skad ces
translated: or if there is an obstacle to one’s relatives.🔽The two, the generation of a mind that is not in accord and the utterance of sinful words, arise for the purpose of dividing the Saṅgha.

original: smos par rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: smos par rig par bya ba ste /
translated: It should be understood that this is what is referred to by the words “for the purpose of dividing, not in accord.”

original: gang zhig gzhan 'dul ba'i phyir skrod pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan 'dul ba'i phyir skrod pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that one is expelled for the purpose of subduing others.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba dag yod la gang zhig rjes su mi mthun pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ston par byed pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba dag yod la gang zhig rjes su mi mthun pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ston par byed pa /
translated: There are those who are intent on dividing the Saṅgha, and there are those who reveal a mind concomitant with improper attention that is not in accord with it.

original: ae ma dge 'dun dbye bar bya'o snyam pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang de dang 'bral ba de lta bu sdig pa can gyi tshig brjod pa de dag la 'byung bar 'gyur na dbyar khas blangs pa las 'da' bar bya ste /
analyzed: ae ma dge 'dun dbye bar bya'o snyam pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang de dang 'bral ba de lta bu sdig pa can gyi tshig brjod pa de dag la 'byung bar 'gyur na dbyar khas blangs pa las 'da' bar bya ste /
translated: “Oh, the Saṅgha should be divided!” Those who utter such sinful words and those who separate from it should pass beyond the rainy season retreat that they have accepted.

original: de ral pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ral pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They will not incur the downfall of breaking the rainy season retreat.

original: de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir mthu yod pa lta na mi 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba dag yod la de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gang la de nus pa'i mthu yod pa de ni mthu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir mthu yod pa lta na mi 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba dag yod la de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gang la de nus pa'i mthu yod pa de ni mthu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: If one has the power to pacify that, one should not go.

original: song na mi 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus las zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: song na mi 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus las zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: If one goes, one should not stay beyond the time.

original: gal te der song nas zhag bdun las 'das su zin kyang bya ba nyid kyis dge slong gi dbyar ral ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: gal te der song nas zhag bdun las 'das su zin kyang bya ba nyid kyis dge slong gi dbyar ral ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas /
translated: If one goes there and stays beyond seven days, one does not incur the downfall of a monk who has broken the rainy season retreat, because of the necessity of the action.

original: nges par 'da' bar bya'o zhes pa 'dir de la gzhol bar bstan pa'i phyir mdor byas pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'da' bar bya'o zhes pa 'dir de la gzhol bar bstan pa'i phyir mdor byas pa'o //
translated: Since it is said that one should definitely go beyond, this is summarized here in order to teach that one should be devoted to that.

original: dam bcas na dbyar gnas pa dang gnas su mi 'brel par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas 'dir dbyar gnas par bya ba'o zhes dbyar gnas par so sor thos na dbyar gnas pa'i don du dbyar gyi gnas su 'brel bar bya ba'i don du gdon mi za
analyzed: dam bcas na dbyar gnas pa dang gnas su mi 'brel par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas 'dir dbyar gnas par bya ba'o zhes dbyar gnas par so sor thos na dbyar gnas pa'i don du dbyar gyi gnas su 'brel bar bya ba'i don du gdon mi za
translated: The meaning is that one should be connected to the rainy season dwelling and the rainy season place for the purpose of staying in the rainy season.

original: bar byas te mi byed na nyes byas so @100b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar byas te mi byed na nyes byas so @100b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not do it, it is a misdeed.

original: gso sbyong gcig pa nyid kyis gnas gnyis su de 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gso sbyong gcig pa nyid kyis gnas gnyis su de 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not the case that one arises in two places by the mere sameness of the purification and restoration.

original: de zhes bya ba ni slar bsnyen nas dbyar gnas pa dang gnas su 'brel par mi byed pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni slar bsnyen nas dbyar gnas pa dang gnas su 'brel par mi byed pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: As for that, it is the misdeed of not being connected to the rainy season dwelling and the place after returning to receive the vows again.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas gnyis la gcig tu dbyar gnas par dam bcas nas /
analyzed: gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas gnyis la gcig tu dbyar gnas par dam bcas nas /
translated: If one promises to stay in the rainy season in two places that have the same purification and restoration,

original: gzhan du dbyar gnas par khas len par byed du zin kyang de la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: gzhan du dbyar gnas par khas len par byed du zin kyang de la nyes pa med de /
translated: and even if one accepts staying in the rainy season in another place, there is no fault in that.

original: gang gi phyir gso sbyong gcig yin pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gso sbyong gcig yin pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same purification and restoration, it is not different.

original: gnas gzhan du song ba la'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du song ba la'o //
translated: It is like a dwelling place that is not occupied because it is incomplete.

original: der ma tshang bar byas pa'i gnas khang du ma bzung ba dang 'dra bar ma 'brel ba 'di la mi gnas par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der ma tshang bar byas pa'i gnas khang du ma bzung ba dang 'dra bar ma 'brel ba 'di la mi gnas par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that this non-connection is not a dwelling place.

original: de la gnas gcig par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la gnas gcig par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is a single dwelling place.

original: gnas de dag la de bas na nyes pa mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas de dag la de bas na nyes pa mi skyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in this.

original: rnyed par gcig pa nyid la ni yod do zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong tha dad pa nyid la rnyed pa ni gcig pa nyid yin na gnas dag la tha dad par nyal ba 'di la bskyed pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnyed par gcig pa nyid la ni yod do zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong tha dad pa nyid la rnyed pa ni gcig pa nyid yin na gnas dag la tha dad par nyal ba 'di la bskyed pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: If the acquisition is the same, there is, because in the case of different poṣadhas, if the acquisition is the same, then there is generation of this sleeping in different dwelling places.

original: gnas pa'i longs spyod tha dad pas gnas kyi byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i longs spyod tha dad pas gnas kyi byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the enjoyment of the dwelling is different, the function of the dwelling is different.

original: don len pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don len pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not in the case of taking up the meaning.

original: rnyed pa zhes smos pas yon bdag gam rnyed pa'i tshad las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes smos pas yon bdag gam rnyed pa'i tshad las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the mention of acquisition, it is different from the benefactor or the measure of acquisition.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis gnas 'dir dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum gnas par bya'o zhes dam bcas nas gnas de gnyis rnyed pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong gis gnas 'dir dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum gnas par bya'o zhes dam bcas nas gnas de gnyis rnyed pa ni /
translated: A fully ordained monk who has promised to remain in this place for the earlier three months of the rainy season and who finds two places

original: gcig la gso sbyong ni tha dad par gyur nas de 'di snyam du 'dir gnas na yang rnyed pa gcig tu zad la /
analyzed: gcig la gso sbyong ni tha dad par gyur nas de 'di snyam du 'dir gnas na yang rnyed pa gcig tu zad la /
translated: where the observance day is different may think, I will stay here and obtain one reward.🔽If I stay there, I will obtain another reward.

original: pha gir gnas na yang rnyed pa gcig gu zad do snyam nas de dam bcas nas mi 'gro zhing dge slong de la der dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum yang mi snang phyi ma yang mi snang la dam ni bcas nas nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin
analyzed: pha gir gnas na yang rnyed pa gcig gu zad do snyam nas de dam bcas nas mi 'gro zhing dge slong de la der dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum yang mi snang phyi ma yang mi snang la dam ni bcas nas nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin

analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyod pa bsal ba'i sgras ni de la sde snod 'dzin pa tsam bsdus pa yin no //

original: 'gyod pa dang de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mi skyed pa nyid ces smos pas ni 'thab krol byed pa med pa 'di gnyis kyang ma bsdus pa ma yin no //

translated: The phrase “not generating regret or suffering and mental dissatisfaction other than that” also includes the absence of quarreling.🔽If one does not relinquish one’s dwelling because one has not accepted it, then one does not relinquish the rains residence.

original: gnas par khas ma blangs pas gnas mi gtong na gnas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni /
analyzed: gnas par khas ma blangs pas gnas mi gtong na gnas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni /
translated: Some texts state:

original: dge slong dbyar gnas par khas mi len pa dag la dbyar ral bar brjod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: dge slong dbyar gnas par khas mi len pa dag la dbyar ral bar brjod par bgyi'am /
translated: “Should one who does not accept the monk’s rains residence be said to have violated the rains retreat?🔽If one does not relinquish one’s dwelling during the rains, one is said to have violated the rains retreat.”

original: gal te dbyar gyi nang du gnas mi gtong na dbyar ral bar brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbyar gyi nang du gnas mi gtong na dbyar ral bar brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //

original: 'dis ni gnas par khas ma blangs su zin kyang dbyar gyi nang du gnas mi gtong na phyi rol du 'gro ba'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya dgos so zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnas par khas ma blangs su zin kyang dbyar gyi nang du gnas mi gtong na phyi rol du 'gro ba'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya dgos so zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: This shows that even if one does not accept the abode, if one does not give up the abode during the rainy season, one must be consecrated in order to go outside.

original: nam mkha' la gnas par khas blangs pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni gnas 'dir de lta bas na rten 'di la 'dir blang ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas par khas blangs pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni gnas 'dir de lta bas na rten 'di la 'dir blang ba'o //
translated: It is not confessed that one accepts the abode in the sky, because it is like that in this abode, therefore it is accepted here in this support.

original: gru la nang du 'byam pa nyid du shes na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: gru la nang du 'byam pa nyid du shes na mi 'chags so //

analyzed: sa la phyin pa dang / sa la gnas pa brtan po dang @101b 'brel pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for arriving on land and being firmly connected to the land.

analyzed: gal te gru sa la phyin par gyur nas sa la gnas pa brtan po dang 'brel bar gyur na nye bar 'gro ba pos shes par ma gyur la /
translated: If the boat arrives on land and becomes firmly connected to the land, but the traveler does not know,

original: de dbyar gyi nang du 'byam par gyur pa nyid du mi shes na de ltar na dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa 'chags kyi gzhan du ni mi 'chags so zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de ltar lo nyi shu ma lon pa bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa de mi shes pa ma lon par grags /

translated: If he does not know that he has wandered into the rainy season, then he has violated the rainy season retreat. Otherwise, he has not violated the rainy season retreat.🔽Thus, one who is less than twenty years old and is fully ordained is called “less than twenty years old and ignorant.”

original: de ltar ma lon pa'i chos can nyid du mi shes pa la ni khas len pa la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma lon pa'i chos can nyid du mi shes pa la ni khas len pa la rig par bya'o //
translated: If he does not know that he is less than twenty years old, he is said to have accepted the rainy season retreat.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gyur dbyar gnas par khas len par bgyid na /🔽dbyar ral bar brjod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gyur dbyar gnas par khas len par bgyid na / dbyar ral bar brjod par bgyi'am /
translated: Here, the text says, “Monks, if you accept the rainy season retreat,🔽should you say that the rainy season has been violated?

original: ral bar brjod par mi bgyi /
analyzed: ral bar brjod par mi bgyi /
translated: Or should you not say that the rainy season has been violated?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: gal te brjod kyi nang du 'byam par 'gyur ba nyid du shes na dbyar ral bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te brjod kyi nang du 'byam par 'gyur ba nyid du shes na dbyar ral bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: “If you know that you have wandered into the rainy season, you should say that the rainy season has been violated.🔽If you do not know that, you should not say that the rainy season has been violated.”

original: 'on te mi shes na ni dbyar ral bar brjod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / kha cig las /
analyzed: 'on te mi shes na ni dbyar ral bar brjod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / kha cig las /
translated: And in some texts,
