translated: If the bedding is spread and the boundary is made different, then any of the many abodes is the abode of the one who performs the rite of spreading the bedding.

original: gang du bting ba de nyid ni 'di'i gnas so snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir gtan pa gding bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang du bting ba de nyid ni 'di'i gnas so snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir gtan pa gding bar bya ste /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt that the site where the boundary is established is the site of the boundary, the boundary is to be established.

original: mtshams tha dad du byed pa la thams cad la gtan pa gding ba nyid ces bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams tha dad du byed pa la thams cad la gtan pa gding ba nyid ces bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The statement, “In the case of a different boundary, the boundary is established for all,” includes this.

original: tha dad pa nyid yin na gnas so sor de dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid yin na gnas so sor de dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is a different boundary, the boundary is to be established for each site.

original: mtshams tha dad pa nyid yin na gnas 'di rnams la gnas so so so sor gtan pa de dbyung dgos kyi thams cad kyis gnas gcig tu 'di phyung ba nyid la gnas gzhan dang 'brel ba rnams kyi gtan pa de rang gi gnas su spo bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams tha dad pa nyid yin na gnas 'di rnams la gnas so so so sor gtan pa de dbyung dgos kyi thams cad kyis gnas gcig tu 'di phyung ba nyid la gnas gzhan dang 'brel ba rnams kyi gtan pa de rang gi gnas su spo bar bya'o //
translated: If there is a different boundary, the boundary is to be established for each of these sites. The boundary is to be established for all in one site. The boundary that is established for the other sites is to be transferred to its own site.

original: yang na rang gi gnas nas 'ga' zhig gtan pa'i drung du gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rang gi gnas nas 'ga' zhig gtan pa'i drung du gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: Or, some of the boundary is to be placed in its own site.

original: gzhan du na de skya rengs 'char ba'i dus su dbyung ba 'grub po snyam du 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na de skya rengs 'char ba'i dus su dbyung ba 'grub po snyam du 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, it should be understood that the boundary is established at the time of dawn.

original: gang zhig so sor mtshams 'gums par bgyid cing so sor bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig so sor mtshams 'gums par bgyid cing so sor bya ste /
translated: Those who individually lift the restrictions and individually perform the rites

original: dbyung ba la gnas de rnams thams cad gtan pa phyung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dbyung ba la gnas de rnams thams cad gtan pa phyung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: of lifting, do all of them lift the restrictions?

original: nye ba 'khor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi 'gyur te /
translated: Upāli, no.

original: gang dag 'byin par byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa dbyung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang dag 'byin par byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa dbyung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Those who lift the restrictions lift the restrictions.

original: gang dag 'byin bar mi byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa phyung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag 'byin bar mi byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa phyung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not lift the restrictions do not lift the restrictions.🔽If the restrictions are lifted in one place, they are lifted everywhere.

original: mtshams gcig pa nyid du ni phyung na thams cad kyis gtan pa phyung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de bas na 'dir mdor byas pa yin no //🔽bye ba nyid na phyogs so so'i zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig tu @120a * //
analyzed: mtshams gcig pa nyid du ni phyung na thams cad kyis gtan pa phyung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de bas na 'dir mdor byas pa yin no // bye ba nyid na phyogs so so'i zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig tu @120a * //
translated: Therefore, this is a summary here.

original: gtogs pa nyid yin na dge 'dun bye zhing phyogs gnyis su gyur na phyogs gcig gis phyung ba phyogs cig shos kyis phyung par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtogs pa nyid yin na dge 'dun bye zhing phyogs gnyis su gyur na phyogs gcig gis phyung ba phyogs cig shos kyis phyung par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is a schism, in each direction, means that if they belong to one place, if the Saṃgha is split into two factions, the lifting of the restrictions by one faction does not constitute the lifting of the restrictions by the other faction.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gtan pa bting ba'i gnas su dge 'dun bye na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gtan pa bting ba'i gnas su dge 'dun bye na /
translated: If the saṅgha is divided in a place where a boundary has been established,

original: der phyogs gcig gam cig shos kyis gtan pa 'byin par bgyid na de dag thams cad kyis gtan pa phyung bar brjod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: der phyogs gcig gam cig shos kyis gtan pa 'byin par bgyid na de dag thams cad kyis gtan pa phyung bar brjod par bgyi'am /
translated: is it said that all of them have dissolved the boundary if one or the other side dissolves the boundary?

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste gang dag 'byin par byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste gang dag 'byin par byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Upāli, do not do that. Those who dissolve it will dissolve the boundary.

original: gang dag mi byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa phyung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mi byed pa de dag gis ni gtan pa phyung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not do it will not dissolve the boundary.

original: ma bting bas phyung ba ni ma phyung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa gang dag la gtan pa bting ba med pa dag ni ma bting ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma bting bas phyung ba ni ma phyung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan du dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa gang dag la gtan pa bting ba med pa dag ni ma bting ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is not established is not dissolved means that those who have not established a boundary in a place where they have agreed to abide during the rainy season are called those who have not established a boundary.

original: de ni ma phyung ba ma yin te phyung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma phyung ba ma yin te phyung ba nyid yin no //
translated: That is not not dissolved, it is dissolved.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa /
translated: Here the text of the Buddha states:🔽Venerable.

original: re zhig dbyar gnas pa'i dge slong gis gtan pa bting nas mtshams kyi slang rol du mchis shing ltos pa ma mchis par gyur na dge slong glo bur ba dag lhags te gtan pa 'byin bar bgyid na gtan pa phyung bar brjod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: re zhig dbyar gnas pa'i dge slong gis gtan pa bting nas mtshams kyi slang rol du mchis shing ltos pa ma mchis par gyur na dge slong glo bur ba dag lhags te gtan pa 'byin bar bgyid na gtan pa phyung bar brjod par bgyi'am /
translated: If a monk who is staying for the rainy season has already laid out the boundary markers and then goes outside the boundary markers without regard for them, and then visiting monks come and remove the boundary markers, should the boundary markers be said to have been removed?

original: nye ba 'khor phyung bar brjod par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor phyung bar brjod par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, they should be said to have been removed.🔽This is not unsuitable because it does not occur.

original: de mi 'byung ba nyid kyis kha bskang du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la dge 'dun gyis gtan pa gding ba la de la kha bskang du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de mi 'byung ba nyid kyis kha bskang du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la dge 'dun gyis gtan pa gding ba la de la kha bskang du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: This is not unsuitable for a boundary that the saṅgha has laid out.

original: 'dir gzhung ni chos gos kyi gzhi zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni chos gos kyi gzhi zhu ba las /
translated: Here the text of the request for the basis of the Dharma robe is:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gcig tu dbyar gnas par khas len cing des dbyar zla ba gsum po dag 'das nas dgag dbye bgyis te dge 'dun la gtan pa gding ba'i chos gos 'bul bar bgyid cing der dge slong glo bur bdag lhags shing de dag
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gcig tu dbyar gnas par khas len cing des dbyar zla ba gsum po dag 'das nas dgag dbye bgyis te dge 'dun la gtan pa gding ba'i chos gos 'bul bar bgyid cing der dge slong glo bur bdag lhags shing de dag
translated: Venerable, if a monk accepts to stay in one place during the rainy season, and after the three months of the rainy season have passed, he performs the invitation ceremony and offers the robe made from refuse rags to the Saṅgha, and then a visiting monk arrives there,

original: gtan pa 'ding ba'i rjes su zhugs te /
analyzed: gtan pa 'ding ba'i rjes su zhugs te /
translated: and he joins in the distribution of the robe.

original: dod na chos gos de sus thob par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: dod na chos gos de sus thob par 'gyur lags /
translated: If he leaves, who would obtain that robe?

original: nye ba 'khor dge slong de nyid kyis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor dge slong de nyid kyis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, it would be that very monk.”🔽It is not the case that it is not suitable to be distributed unless it is distributed.

original: ma bting ba nyid kyis dbyung bar mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la gtan pa bting bar mi 'gyur ba de la de 'ding bar byed pa'i dge 'dun de la kha bskang du rung ba'o //
analyzed: ma bting ba nyid kyis dbyung bar mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la gtan pa bting bar mi 'gyur ba de la de 'ding bar byed pa'i dge 'dun de la kha bskang du rung ba'o //
translated: If it is not distributed to that Saṅgha, it is suitable to be added to that Saṅgha.

original: dge slong glo bur bdag 'ongs te gtan pa 'ding bar bgyid na zhes bya ba 'dir don gyis 'byung ba der mdor byas @120b pa'o ;
analyzed: dge slong glo bur bdag 'ongs te gtan pa 'ding bar bgyid na zhes bya ba 'dir don gyis 'byung ba der mdor byas @120b pa'o ;
translated: If a visiting monk arrives and distributes it, the meaning of this is understood in the sūtra.

original: / gtan pa bting ba snam sbyar med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa dang sum mdo tshun chad du 'dug pa la yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni ji srid sum mdo tshun chad du 'dug pa dang grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa
analyzed: / gtan pa bting ba snam sbyar med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa dang sum mdo tshun chad du 'dug pa la yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni ji srid sum mdo tshun chad du 'dug pa dang grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa
translated: There is no offense if the seat is spread out, if one enters the village without the outer robe, and so on, or if one sits in a place within three yojanas of the village.

original: la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “and so on” is that there is no offense if one sits in a place within three yojanas of the village or if one enters the village.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni don las thob pas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir mdor byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni don las thob pas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir mdor byas pa'o //
translated: However, this is stated in brief in order to clarify the meaning of the rule.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: btsun ba gtan pa bting ba'i gnas na rkyen du dag bag yangs su 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun ba gtan pa bting ba'i gnas na rkyen du dag bag yangs su 'gyur lags /
translated: “Venerable, is it permissible to relax the rules in a place where the seat is spread out?”

original: nye ba 'khor bcu ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor bcu ste /
translated: Upāli, there are ten.

original: bcug gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par rgyu ba dang / smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pas ci bder ljongs rgyu ba dang / mtshan mo 'bral ba med pa dang / zhag bcu 'da' bar med pa dang /
analyzed: yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par rgyu ba dang / smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pas ci bder ljongs rgyu ba dang / mtshan mo 'bral ba med pa dang / zhag bcu 'da' bar med pa dang /
translated: Eating again and again, eating in a group, wandering without permission, wandering the countryside as one pleases with one’s lower and upper robes in order, not being separated at night, not staying beyond ten days,

original: zla ba 'da' bar med pa dang // gos ji tsam gyis chog pa slong ba dang gos rung bar byas pa dag ji tsam 'dod pa dag 'chang ba dang / ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug nas dpyid zlar ba nya'i bar du dbyar gnas pa'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mi bgo ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: zla ba 'da' bar med pa dang // gos ji tsam gyis chog pa slong ba dang gos rung bar byas pa dag ji tsam 'dod pa dag 'chang ba dang / ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug nas dpyid zlar ba nya'i bar du dbyar gnas pa'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mi bgo ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang /
translated: From the sixteenth day of the middle month of autumn until the full moon of the last month of autumn, the Saṅgha should not distribute the offerings of the rainy season.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du dge slong gis khyim gzhan du smad g-yogs dang stod g-yogs kyis 'dug par bya'o zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du dge slong gis khyim gzhan du smad g-yogs dang stod g-yogs kyis 'dug par bya'o zhes gsungs nas /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavān said, “A monk should sit in another’s house wearing an underskirt and upper robe.”

original: btsun ba sum mdo dang bzhi mdo dag tu smad g-yogs dang stod g-yogs kyis mchis su rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun ba sum mdo dang bzhi mdo dag tu smad g-yogs dang stod g-yogs kyis mchis su rung ngam /
translated: “Lord, is it proper to sit in a three-way or four-way junction wearing an underskirt and upper robe?”🔽“Upāli, it is proper to sit on a permanent seat.”

original: nye ba 'khor gtan pa bting par rung ngo zhes gsungs pa de gnyis ka'i 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gtan pa bting par rung ngo zhes gsungs pa de gnyis ka'i 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Both of these are included here.

original: gtan pa'i gzhi zhu ba la sogs pa'i skabs so //
analyzed: gtan pa'i gzhi zhu ba la sogs pa'i skabs so //
translated: This is the section on asking for a permanent site and so on.

original: sra brkyang gi gzhi rdzogs so /
analyzed: sra brkyang gi gzhi rdzogs so /
translated: The basis of the shaking out of the robes is finished.

original: // / mtshon gyis ma dras pa'i gos spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: // / mtshon gyis ma dras pa'i gos spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: One should not use cloth that is not cut with a knife.

original: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis khyim bag gi gos mtshon gyis ma dras pa dag kha dog ngan par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis khyim bag gi gos mtshon gyis ma dras pa dag kha dog ngan par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, monks, you should make householders’ cloth that is not cut with a knife ugly in color.

original: bcang bar gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin gyi kha dog ngan par byas pa dang bral ba ltung byed du gsungs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bcang bar gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin gyi kha dog ngan par byas pa dang bral ba ltung byed du gsungs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is said that you should keep it, but it is not said that a downfall is accrued by being without that which is made ugly in color.

original: lhag ma yang 'di dang nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma yang 'di dang nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: The remainder is to be applied in the same way.

original: dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: It is said, “One should consecrate that which is cut and sewn as a Dharma robe.”

original: rnam pa gang gis drubs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis drubs pa gang zhe na /
translated: In what way is it cut and sewn?

original: de'i phyir snam phran sbrel gzhi nyid dang lhag ma mnyam pa nyid dang / dbus nas gzhan du glengs bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid dang mtha' bskor ba nyid dag gis so zhes bya @121a * //🔽pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snam phran sbrel gzhi nyid dang lhag ma mnyam pa nyid dang / dbus nas gzhan du glengs bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid dang mtha' bskor ba nyid dag gis so zhes bya @121a * //🔽pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “By the joining of the patches, by the equality of the remainder, by the extension of the middle in one direction, and by the turning of the edges.”

original: gding ba sgrub par byed pa'i dum bu rnams la phyed dang gsum gyi dkyil 'khor nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gsungs so //
analyzed: gding ba sgrub par byed pa'i dum bu rnams la phyed dang gsum gyi dkyil 'khor nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga gsungs so //
translated: The procedure for the patches that make up the mat is stated in the verse beginning, “The mat itself is three and a half cubits in size.”

original: de'i phyir de srid du sgrub par byed pa'i dum bu'i dbang du byas nas mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de srid du sgrub par byed pa'i dum bu'i dbang du byas nas mdo 'di byas so //
translated: Therefore, the sutra is composed with reference to the patches that make up the mat.

original: glegs bu 'phro bzung pa'i dbus nas snam phran rnams la lhag ma gang yin ba de ni 'dir lhag ma nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: glegs bu 'phro bzung pa'i dbus nas snam phran rnams la lhag ma gang yin ba de ni 'dir lhag ma nyid du gsungs so //
translated: The remaining patches are stated here as the “remainder” from the middle of the cloth.

original: phyogs phyogs su zhes zlos bur bya ste /🔽dbus kyi snam phran gzhan rnams mngon par khyab par bsgrub pa'i don du snam phran sbrel gzhi nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs phyogs su zhes zlos bur bya ste / dbus kyi snam phran gzhan rnams mngon par khyab par bsgrub pa'i don du snam phran sbrel gzhi nyid do //
translated: The word “side” is to be supplied.🔽The patches are joined together in order to make up the middle patch.

original: lhag ma mnyam pa nyid dang dbus nas gzhan glegs bu 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma mnyam pa nyid dang dbus nas gzhan glegs bu 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The remaining patches are the same as the middle one, and the patches are arranged in the same way as the middle one.

original: glegs bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: glegs bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The patches are arranged in the same way as the middle one.

original: rgyud gzhan gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i glegs bu'i 'phro de'i dngos po dang mtha' skor nyid dag gis sbyin ba rjes su song ba nyid de de ltar rnam pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i glegs bu'i 'phro de'i dngos po dang mtha' skor nyid dag gis sbyin ba rjes su song ba nyid de de ltar rnam pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that these four aspects are the four aspects of the object of the vow of individual liberation.

original: ji tsam du gyon pa'i gos gang la chos gos kyi don du rnam pa de lta bur byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam du gyon pa'i gos gang la chos gos kyi don du rnam pa de lta bur byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
translated: How much clothing is to be consecrated as the form of the three robes?

original: de'i phyir mthang gos dang bla gos dang snam sbyar la'o zhes bya ba smos te gsum char la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthang gos dang bla gos dang snam sbyar la'o zhes bya ba smos te gsum char la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in the lower robe, upper robe, and patched robe,” meaning in all three.

original: dge slong mas ni shing dpung chad dang rdul gzhan rnam pa gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag dang de ma thag pa'i gsum po dge slong mas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas ni shing dpung chad dang rdul gzhan rnam pa gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag dang de ma thag pa'i gsum po dge slong mas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: For a nun, it is any kind of cloth, such as a tree bark robe or a dust heap robe. These three, together with the previous three, are to be consecrated by a nun.

original: rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhes smos pa ni dras shing drubs pa zhes bya ba las bzlog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhes smos pa ni dras shing drubs pa zhes bya ba las bzlog pa'i don du'o //
translated: “Any kind” is stated to exclude the meaning of “cut and sewn.”

original: 'di'i gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
analyzed: 'di'i gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
translated: The texts of this Vinaya state:🔽In the rite of full ordination, the five robes should be consecrated.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga las chos gos lnga po rnams byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dge slong ma'i so sor thar pa dang / de'i rnam par 'byed pa dag las /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho ga las chos gos lnga po rnams byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dge slong ma'i so sor thar pa dang / de'i rnam par 'byed pa dag las /
translated: In the Bhikṣuṇī Prātimokṣa and its commentary, it states:

original: dge slong ma chos gos zin pas gtan pa phyung nas /
analyzed: dge slong ma chos gos zin pas gtan pa phyung nas /
translated: If a fully ordained bhikṣuṇī who has completed her robes goes outside the boundary,

original: gal te chos gos lnga po gang yang rung ba dag las chos gos gcig dang / nub gcig mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos gos lnga po gang yang rung ba dag las chos gos gcig dang / nub gcig mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: if she is separated from any of the five robes or from one night, it is a pāyattika offense.

original: chos gos lnga po dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos lnga po dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: The five robes are:

original: snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / shing dpung chad dang / rdul gzan zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / shing dpung chad dang / rdul gzan zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: the patched robe, the upper robe, the lower robe, the sweat-absorbing cloth, and the dust cloth.

original: brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one has a substitute means:

original: gal te @121b chos gos dras shing drubs pa brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na de'i tshe yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te @121b chos gos dras shing drubs pa brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na de'i tshe yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If there is a substitute for the patched and sewn robe, then at that time it should be consecrated.

original: gal te mi bdog na ni dras shing drubs pa ma yin pa la yang byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te mi bdog na ni dras shing drubs pa ma yin pa la yang byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: If there is no substitute, then it should be consecrated even if it is not patched and sewn.

original: chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not remain without consecrating the robe.

original: de dag bzhag ste skya rangs 'chad ba 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag bzhag ste skya rangs 'chad ba 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not pass the dawn having left them behind.

original: chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa gsum dang 'bral bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa gsum dang 'bral bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not be separated from the three consecrated robes.

original: brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na'o zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bas 'brel bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na'o zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bas 'brel bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as connected with the phrase “if there is a substitute.”

original: nyin zhag 'da' bar byed na de lta bu'i rigs can rnams la 'da' bar bya ba nyid du rigs pa de bas na skya rengs 'char ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyin zhag 'da' bar byed na de lta bu'i rigs can rnams la 'da' bar bya ba nyid du rigs pa de bas na skya rengs 'char ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one passes the night, it is appropriate to pass it in that way. Therefore, it is said that one should not pass the dawn.

original: gzhan med na kha ma bsgyur ba la yang byin gyis brlab pa 'chags so zhes bya ba ni kha bsgyur ba med na chos gos gsum po 'di kha ma bsgyur ba la yang rnam par rtog pa dor nas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan med na kha ma bsgyur ba la yang byin gyis brlab pa 'chags so zhes bya ba ni kha bsgyur ba med na chos gos gsum po 'di kha ma bsgyur ba la yang rnam par rtog pa dor nas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: This means that if there is no bleaching, then the three robes are consecrated in the unbleached, having abandoned conceptualization.

original: de la dor bas dogs pa la go skabs nyid do //
analyzed: de la dor bas dogs pa la go skabs nyid do //
translated: In this case, there is no doubt about the possibility.

original: kha bsgyur ba nyid la yang 'di 'chags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba med pas rab tu ma rnyed pa la kha ma bsgyur ba'i don la rung bas ci zhig bsgyur bar bya ste /
analyzed: kha bsgyur ba nyid la yang 'di 'chags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba med pas rab tu ma rnyed pa la kha ma bsgyur ba'i don la rung bas ci zhig bsgyur bar bya ste /
translated: It is also not the case that this is explained in the bleaching itself, since it is not well known. What is the use of bleaching the unbleached, which is suitable for the purpose?

original: 'dir yang dogs pa med ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dogs pa med ba kho na'o //
translated: Here also there is no doubt.

original: gang gi phyir longs spyod pa la kha bsgyur ba nyid dang / yan lag gi ngo bor rung ba la longs spyod pa'i nges pa la yan lag nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir longs spyod pa la kha bsgyur ba nyid dang / yan lag gi ngo bor rung ba la longs spyod pa'i nges pa la yan lag nyid do //
translated: Because of the bleaching itself and the suitability for the nature of the parts, there is certainty in the enjoyment, which is the part.

original: kha bsgyur ba nyid ni rung ba'o //
analyzed: kha bsgyur ba nyid ni rung ba'o //
translated: Bleaching itself is suitable.

original: de ltar yang dkar po'i bya ba nyid bsal bas don 'di rung ba'i gzhi byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang dkar po'i bya ba nyid bsal bas don 'di rung ba'i gzhi byed pa ma yin no //

original: de lta bas na kha ma bsgyur ba la yang byin gyis brlab pa 'chags pas na don 'di byas so //🔽ma dras pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan zin pa la yang byin gyis brlab pa 'chags so //
analyzed: de lta bas na kha ma bsgyur ba la yang byin gyis brlab pa 'chags pas na don 'di byas so // ma dras pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan zin pa la yang byin gyis brlab pa 'chags so //
translated: Therefore, even if it is not dyed, it is consecrated.🔽Even if it is not woven, it is consecrated.

original: de drang ba'i don du yang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: de drang ba'i don du yang gi sgra'o //
translated: The word “even” means that it is consecrated even if it is not woven.

original: 'dir gzhan zin pa ni dras ba gzhan ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan zin pa ni dras ba gzhan ma zin pa'o //
translated: Here, “not woven” means not woven by another.🔽If one has the means, one should have it woven.

original: de la gal te 'byor na lhan thabs glan no zhes bya ba de la zhes bya ba ni ma dras pa la'o //
analyzed: de la gal te 'byor na lhan thabs glan no zhes bya ba de la zhes bya ba ni ma dras pa la'o //
translated: “Here” means “on the unconsecrated cloth.”

original: gzhan ma zin pa byin gyis brlab par 'dod pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa la de'i tshe gzhan ma zin pa la'o ;
analyzed: gzhan ma zin pa byin gyis brlab par 'dod pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa la de'i tshe gzhan ma zin pa la'o ;
translated: If one wishes to consecrate the cloth that is not woven by another, then at that time it is not woven by another.

original: / gal te 'byor na zhes bya ba ni lhan thabs glan pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: / gal te 'byor na zhes bya ba ni lhan thabs glan pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “If one has the means” means that one should give the means to have it woven.

original: khyim du rung ba'i rnam pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim du rung ba'i rnam pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhan zin pa med na byin gyis brlab pa 'chags pa'o zhes bya ba 'di la yang gi sgras ni dgug pa'o //
translated: “Also” means that if one does not have the means to have it woven by another, it is consecrated.

original: khyim du rung ba'i rnam pa 'di la yod pas na khyim du rung ba'i rnam @122a * //
analyzed: khyim du rung ba'i rnam pa 'di la yod pas na khyim du rung ba'i rnam @122a * //

original: pa'o ; / rung bas kyang dge slong gi chos gos kyi rnam pa nyid du ma red pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'o ; / rung bas kyang dge slong gi chos gos kyi rnam pa nyid du ma red pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not suitable for the form of the monk's robes.

original: phying ba dang la ba dang be'u phrug dang klam dang sengs pa rnams ni mi dra bar lhan thabs su klan zhing drub po zhes bya ba ni chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: phying ba dang la ba dang be'u phrug dang klam dang sengs pa rnams ni mi dra bar lhan thabs su klan zhing drub po zhes bya ba ni chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The felt, blanket, sheepskin, and coarse wool are not woven, but are sewn together by hand. The meaning is that they are consecrated as robes.

original: spu can ni chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: spu can ni chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes gsungs mod kyi /

analyzed: spu can ni la ba dang be'u phrug dag la 'di dag spu byi ba yang srid pas 'dir de gnyis gzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The hairy one is included in the blanket and sheepskin, because it is possible that they are made of animal hair.🔽Here, the treatise states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag lnga po dag ni mi 'dra ba dag yin te //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag lnga po dag ni mi 'dra ba dag yin te //

original: phying pa thams cad dang / la ba thams cad dang / be'u phrug thams cad dang / klam thams cad dang / gos sengs pa thams cad dang / lhan thabs glan te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: de la cung zad kyang nus par bya ba ma yin mod kyi 'dir byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid kyis khas blangs pa rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ltar shes pa yin no //

translated: Although it is not possible to do anything about it, here it is understood that the acceptance is realized by the very act of consecration.

analyzed: gnas mal mi gtsang bas gos par gyur na de'i mod la sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: ni khri dang khri'u las gzhan pa'o //

analyzed: de smras pa / bdag gis gding ba ma bsdus so //

analyzed: de rtsa'i khri la nyal zhing ma bsdus pa de bas na de dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //

translated: The Buddha said to the monks: If you are sick, you may sleep on grass mats and grass stools, etc.🔽 The Buddha said to the monks: If you are sick, you may sleep on grass mats and grass stools, etc.🔽 The Buddha said to the monks: If you are sick, you may sleep on grass mats and grass stools, etc.

analyzed: rtsva'i khri dang khri'u rjes su gnang ba'i 'jig pa'i chos can dang ldan par gyur pa la yang dri ma can du byas pa don med pa ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha said to the monks: If you are sick, you may sleep on grass mats and grass stools, etc.

analyzed: de lta bas na de dang ldan ba la yang 'di'i rjes su 'brangs pas rtogs par bya'o //

analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi ma yin bas so //

analyzed: dge 'dun @122b las gzhan gyi gding ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gding ba med pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa las ji srid du nye bar longs spyod par mi bya'o //

analyzed: 'dug pa'i stan yan chad la yang gding ba med par dge 'dun gyi la 'dug par mi bya'o //

analyzed: 'dir longs spyod pa ni khongs su ma gtogs pa ni ma yin no snyam du shes par bya ba'i don to //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las rig par bya'o //

analyzed: gding g-yogs la yang zhes bya ba ni steng du g-yogs pa la gding g-yogs su 'dod do //

analyzed: gzhan yang bar chad ma bcug pa ni /

analyzed: thams cad kyi khra bo phal cher ma nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi gnas mal la yang gding bar ma byas pa la mi 'dug pa las gding g-yogs la yang bar chad ma bcug par nye bar spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya
translated: The phrase and most of the variegated means that one should not use a mat that has not been spread out on the bed or seat of another person, and one should not interfere with the use of a mat that has been spread out.

analyzed: bar chad ma bcug pa'i cho ga las kyang gding ba'i cho ga'o //

analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad du 'dis gnyi ga'i khongs su bsdus par byas pa'o //

analyzed: @123a * // de ni stug na tshig rkyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gding ba de'o //

original: phyogs gang du zhe na /

translated: “It is suitable to be made of cotton, wool, linen, or silk” means that one should understand that the three robes are also extra robes because the specific types are not mentioned, and because it is not possible to understand the specific types.

analyzed: srin bal gyi dang bal gyi dag ces smos so //

analyzed: sha na'i dang zar ma'i rung ba dag la ni rtsub par gyur pa'i phyir gso ma dag gos la sogs pa bzhin no //

analyzed: snams su ma byas pa dang gso ma ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos la sogs pa dang / gso ma la sogs pa'i gos ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: spang pa'i zhu ba las nyes byas byed pa nyid kyi mi rung ba'i khongs su gang zhig ma gtogs pa la go rims byed pa de 'dir bsdus pa'o //

analyzed: skra las byas pa dang gcer bu pa dang bya 'ug pa pa yang dag par len pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /

original: 'dir so sor yang dag par len pa'i sgra mngon par 'bab po //
analyzed: 'dir so sor yang dag par len pa'i sgra mngon par 'bab po //
translated: The term “to take up” is clearly implied here.

original: skra'i la ba yang dag par len pa dang // gcer bu pa yang dag par len pa dang / bya 'ug pa pa yang dag par len pa dang ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skra'i la ba yang dag par len pa dang // gcer bu pa yang dag par len pa dang / bya 'ug pa pa yang dag par len pa dang ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is illogical to take up the practice of wearing matted hair, being naked, or the practice of the owl.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:🔽The Questions of the Son of the Brahman

original: @123b dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /🔽mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po gcer bu pa nyid dang / bya 'ug pa nyid dang / skra'i la ba 'chang bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @123b dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las / mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po gcer bu pa nyid dang / bya 'ug pa nyid dang / skra'i la ba 'chang bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: states:🔽If you take up the three banners of tīrthikas—being naked, the practice of the owl, or wearing a mat of grass—you commit a serious violation.

original: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If you take up a banner of a tīrthika other than these three, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: yang dag par blang ba mngon du gtong bas 'chang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //

translated: There, grave means that the offense of a grave downfall is incurred in the correct acceptance of hair, nakedness, and the owl.

translated: The term other means that the practice of the other three correct acceptances is not suitable for practice.

analyzed: yang dag par blang pa sngon du btang ba'i bsten pa la ni nyes byas te da bas na de'i 'di byed pa'o //

analyzed: thams cad du mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan 'chang ba de dag dag pa dang grol bar 'dzin pas 'chang na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //

original: 'dir yang dag par blang ba la tha dad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dag par blang ba la tha dad pa nyid yin te /

original: sbyor ba grub pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba grub pa nyid ni ma yin no //

translated: It is also for the purpose of a trustworthy person.

original: yid gcugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang yin pa de'i don du ma bcol yang mnod par bya ste /
analyzed: yid gcugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang yin pa de'i don du ma bcol yang mnod par bya ste /
translated: For the sake of a trustworthy person, one should accept a bed, even if not requested.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan por gyur pa nyid la mnod par bya'o /
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan por gyur pa nyid la mnod par bya'o /
translated: One should accept it from a preceptor or teacher.

original: rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin ba'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye ba'i phyogs su song ba'i don du yang mnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin ba'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye ba'i phyogs su song ba'i don du yang mnod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not do it for the sake of one who is not on one's own side. One should not accept a bed for the sake of one who has gone to the side of an enemy.

original: de ni gnas mal la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni gnas mal la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This also applies to beds.

original: gnas mal gnod par bya ba nyid la yang de ma bcol ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas mal gnod par bya ba nyid la yang de ma bcol ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that even in the case of a bed that is harmful, one should not accept it without being requested, and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: gnas mal gyi gzhung zhu ba las /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi gzhung zhu ba las /
translated: In the text on beds,

original: yid gcugs gnas kyi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gis bcol ba gang du yang yid ches pa'i don du gyur pa ste /🔽de'i phyir mngon du @125a * //
analyzed: yid gcugs gnas kyi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gis bcol ba gang du yang yid ches pa'i don du gyur pa ste / de'i phyir mngon du @125a * //
translated: it says, For the sake of a trustworthy person, and so on. One should accept a bed for the sake of a trustworthy person, even if not requested.

original: phyogs par gyur pa'i don la gnas mal mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs par gyur pa'i don la gnas mal mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should accept a bed for the sake of a person who is present.

original: khas blangs pas khas ma blangs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba der don de tsam du gsungs so //
analyzed: khas blangs pas khas ma blangs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba der don de tsam du gsungs so //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.🔽The application is also to gain, for it is connected with non-gain.

original: rnyed pa la yang sbyor ba 'di rnyed pa ma yin par 'brel pa la yang 'dir yang zhes bya ba de ltar smos so //
analyzed: rnyed pa la yang sbyor ba 'di rnyed pa ma yin par 'brel pa la yang 'dir yang zhes bya ba de ltar smos so //
translated: The word “also” is used here.

original: zas la yang ngo zhes bya ba yang ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: zas la yang ngo zhes bya ba yang ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rig par bya ba ste /
translated: It is also to food, for it is understood that one should not accept an invitation if one is not sent.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is:

original: 'dul byed dag las tha snyad 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dul byed dag las tha snyad 'di yin no //
translated: This is the convention in the Vinaya.

original: 'god pa dang ma byin bar len par rtogs pa 'di yang gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'god pa dang ma byin bar len par rtogs pa 'di yang gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med pa'i phyir te /
translated: This understanding of “placing” and “taking what is not given” is not the context of another’s words.

original: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig der don gsungs so //
analyzed: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig der don gsungs so //
translated: “One should not accept an invitation if one is not sent.” This is the meaning of the passage.

original: de thams cad la ma bcol ba nyid la ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir thams cad de 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad la ma bcol ba nyid la ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir thams cad de 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “It is not so for all of them if one is not sent,” and so on. This is the presentation here. Therefore, all of this should be applied here.

original: gzhan gyi don du mnod par pha rol la go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang mnod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du mnod par pha rol la go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang mnod par bya ste /
translated: One should take it from another,

original: zas gcig pu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zas gcig pu ni ma yin no //

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed dag las /

analyzed: tha snyad 'di 'gyod pa gcig pu las skabs med par bya ba'i phyir zas mnod pa las gleng gzhi de las byed pa'o //

original: tha snyad la ni zas mnod pa ma yin te /🔽mnod par byed pas gzhan la go bar bya'o zhes bya ba tsam zhig gsungs te gzhan du mnod par bya ba la cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha snyad la ni zas mnod pa ma yin te / mnod par byed pas gzhan la go bar bya'o zhes bya ba tsam zhig gsungs te gzhan du mnod par bya ba la cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: But in the rule itself, it does not say that one should take food.🔽It simply says that one should understand from another that one should take it.

original: de ltar na bye brag la ma brten pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bye brag la ma brten pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure for taking it from another, and it is not based on a specific case.

original: mi dbang bas nang du zhugs te mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi dbang bas nang du zhugs te mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gi gzhan gyi rnyed par 'jug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: de na dge slong gi dbang du mdzad nas gnang ba'o //
analyzed: de na dge slong gi dbang du mdzad nas gnang ba'o //

original: 'thob pa rnams kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang //
analyzed: 'thob pa rnams kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang //

analyzed: gang du de rnams 'gro ba der gtogs pa'i rnam par nges pa la zhes bya ba de ni don gyis rtogs par bya'o //

original: gang du yang de rnams 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gang du yang de rnams 'gro ba ste /
translated: Where they go, there is the determination of belonging.

original: phul ba'i rdzas la khyim che ge mo ni khyed kyi'o //
analyzed: phul ba'i rdzas la khyim che ge mo ni khyed kyi'o //

original: khyim che ge mo ni nged kyi'o //
analyzed: khyim che ge mo ni nged kyi'o //

original: lam po che 'di ni khyed kyi'o //
analyzed: lam po che 'di ni khyed kyi'o //

original: lam po che 'di ni nged kyi'o //
analyzed: lam po che 'di ni nged kyi'o //

translated: Having established such rules, they agree to stay for the rainy season in two different places, according to whether they accept or do not accept the Dharma.🔽The gain of the other place is the gain of the other house, which is determined by the other place.

original: / khyim de nyid du rnam par nges par byas pa'i phyogs kyi rnyed pa de'o //
analyzed: / khyim de nyid du rnam par nges par byas pa'i phyogs kyi rnyed pa de'o //
translated: The gain of the other place is the gain of the other house, which is determined by the other place.

analyzed: 'di la gcig la sogs pa ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge 'dun la brten nas phul ba'i rnyed pa la gal te /
