analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang du gtogs par gyur pa gnyis sam gsum ni dge 'dun nyid do //
translated: If the acquisition is offered in dependence on the community, if there are two or three within the same boundary, they are the community.

original: de la de tsam der 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la de tsam der 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not suitable for just that much to be for just that.

original: skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning 'ga' zhig la brten nas dbyar gnas par khas len cing gnas med par de na bud med la sogs pas dbul bar byed na de gnas che ge mor dge 'dun la phul lo zer la /
analyzed: skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning 'ga' zhig la brten nas dbyar gnas par khas len cing gnas med par de na bud med la sogs pas dbul bar byed na de gnas che ge mor dge 'dun la phul lo zer la /
translated: If one accepts the rains residence in dependence on a man, woman, or neuter person, and if one lives without a residence, and if a woman, etc.

original: gal te de ltar gnas der mtshams gang yin pa'i khongs su chud pa de rnams kyi rnyed pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar gnas der mtshams gang yin pa'i khongs su chud pa de rnams kyi rnyed pa ni de yin no //
translated: If it is the case that the acquisition is for those who are included in the boundary of that residence,

original: gal te bdag gis 'di nyid kyi dge 'dun la phul lo zhes zer la //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis 'di nyid kyi dge 'dun la phul lo zhes zer la //
translated: if one says, “I offer this to the community of just this place,”

original: gal te de na gang zag gzhan med na ni rnyed pa de mtshams kyis bstabs pa yin no ;
analyzed: gal te de na gang zag gzhan med na ni rnyed pa de mtshams kyis bstabs pa yin no ;
translated: if there are no other individuals there, that acquisition is distributed by the boundary.

original: / gal te 'di khyod kho na la phul lo zhes zer na ni rnyed pa de rten gyis bstabs pa yin te rten gyi dbang gis grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / gal te 'di khyod kho na la phul lo zhes zer na ni rnyed pa de rten gyis bstabs pa yin te rten gyi dbang gis grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he says, “This is given to you alone,” then that acquisition is given by the basis, which means it is established by the power of the basis.🔽The acquisition of Dharma is controlled by those who teach it.

original: chos kyi rnyed pa ni de smra ba rnams dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir smra ba rnams la shugs kyis dbang byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pa ni de smra ba rnams dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir smra ba rnams la shugs kyis dbang byed pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the power of the basis is indirect.

original: de'i sgras ni chos dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgras ni chos dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The word “it” refers to the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rnyed pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The acquisition of Dharma is not controlled by the basis.

original: 'dul ba bye brag tu bshad pa dag las mya ngan las 'das pa dag la phul ba ni mchod rten gyi dang 'dra bar gzhag go zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: 'dul ba bye brag tu bshad pa dag las mya ngan las 'das pa dag la phul ba ni mchod rten gyi dang 'dra bar gzhag go zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The Vinaya-vibhāṣā says, “That which is given to those in nirvana is like a stupa.

original: de'i phyir 'dir chos rin po che ma yin gyi 'on te gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir chos rin po che ma yin gyi 'on te gzhan yin te /
translated: ” Therefore, here the Dharma is not a precious thing.

original: sil bu dag las kyang der chos gzhan bzung ba zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: sil bu dag las kyang der chos gzhan bzung ba zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: But if it is something else, it should be understood that another thing is taken as the Dharma from among the scattered teachings.

original: / rin po che'i go rims 'di ni zhes bya ba gal te yod par 'gyur na ni mi mkhas pa la rin po che'i go rims la brda byas pa la chos kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: / rin po che'i go rims 'di ni zhes bya ba gal te yod par 'gyur na ni mi mkhas pa la rin po che'i go rims la brda byas pa la chos kyi ming ngo //
translated: If this order of jewels were to exist, it would be the name of the Dharma, since the order of jewels is a conventional symbol for the wise.

original: gtsug lag khang gi tshigs su bcad la gcig 'dzin pa ni 'dir de nyid kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba po nyid la'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi tshigs su bcad la gcig 'dzin pa ni 'dir de nyid kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba po nyid la'o //
translated: The end of that very thing is here means that the end of that very thing is the recitation of a verse from the scriptures. The term that very thing refers to the very thing that is the expounder of the Dharma.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnyed pa dbang ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnyed pa dbang ba 'di la'o //
translated: This refers to this acquisition of the Dharma that is under one's control.

original: mdo 'di ni rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gzhung las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gzhung las 'byung ngo //
translated: This sūtra appears in the text of the basis for dispute.

original: mtshan mi mthun pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la cig shos yod na mi dbang ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la cig shos yod na mi dbang ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the other exists, it is not under one's control with regard to the property of the dead whose gender is not the same.

original: mtshan mi mthun pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whose gender is not the same means

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:🔽Among the nidānas,

original: gleng gzhi rnams las /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnams las /
translated: it is said:

original: dge slong dag dge tshul gyi rgyud du gtogs pa de'o zhes @127a * //🔽gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge tshul gyi rgyud du gtogs pa de'o zhes @127a * //🔽gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Monks, that which belongs to the category of novice monks.

original: ci thams cad du rnam par gzhag pa 'di yin nam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir cis shos yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci thams cad du rnam par gzhag pa 'di yin nam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir cis shos yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Is this the rule in all cases? No, it is not. Therefore, the root text states, “If the other is present.”

original: cig shos zhes bya ba gong na mtshan mthun ba yod pa de mtshan ma mthun ba mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba gong na mtshan mthun ba yod pa de mtshan ma mthun ba mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other is the one who has the same characteristics as the one who is dead. The meaning is that the one who has the same characteristics as the one who is dead is not an owner.🔽The same is true of one who has been expelled.

original: gnas nas phyung ba'i yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni cig shos yod na shi ba'i yo byad la yang gnas nas phyung ba'i mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas nas phyung ba'i yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni cig shos yod na shi ba'i yo byad la yang gnas nas phyung ba'i mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this verse is that if the other is present, then one who has been expelled is not an owner of the property of the dead.

original: 'dir gnas nas phyung ba'i ni cig shos nyid la mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnas nas phyung ba'i ni cig shos nyid la mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Here, one who has been expelled is included in the other.

original: 'dir gnas nas ma phyung ba la ni cig shos kyi sgra'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnas nas ma phyung ba la ni cig shos kyi sgra'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Here, one who has not been expelled is included in the term the other.

original: med na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni cig shos la'o //
analyzed: med na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni cig shos la'o //
translated: If the other is not present, then the one who has been expelled is an owner.

original: rgyu las sems ma log na'o zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis de spang ba'i las byas pa'i rgyu de las sems ma log cing bzlog par ma byas pa de la'o //
analyzed: rgyu las sems ma log na'o zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis de spang ba'i las byas pa'i rgyu de las sems ma log cing bzlog par ma byas pa de la'o //
translated: The cause is whatever cause of downfall not being seen, etc. by which the action of abandoning is done. The mind does not turn away from that cause, does not turn back from it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: gang dbang lags /
analyzed: gang dbang lags /
translated: “What is the cause?

original: de dag las gang gis dang por sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa spong bar byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gang gis dang por sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa spong bar byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By which the first abandonment of the forms of bad views is done.”

original: gang gis ma btang ba nyid la gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba'i 'dir tshig yod pa de de bas na 'dir mdo byas so //
analyzed: gang gis ma btang ba nyid la gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba'i 'dir tshig yod pa de de bas na 'dir mdo byas so //
translated: And in the phrase “by which it is not given up, by another also,” the word “also” is present. Therefore, the sutra is composed here.

original: 'dir lta ba dang / 'brel ba spang ba'i rgyu las mngon par zhen par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir lta ba dang / 'brel ba spang ba'i rgyu las mngon par zhen par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the cause of abandoning views and connections should be understood as clinging.

original: mchog nyid du mthong ba'i rab tu dbye ba nyid kyi phyir 'di la lta ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog nyid du mthong ba'i rab tu dbye ba nyid kyi phyir 'di la lta ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the distinction of seeing it as supreme, it should be understood as a view here.

original: de'i de mnod par bya ba nyid la de ni tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i de mnod par bya ba nyid la de ni tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is not different in its being taken up by that.

original: spangs pa de shi ba'i yo byad rnams de mnod par bya ba nyid la spangs pa de ma spangs pa dang tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa de shi ba'i yo byad rnams de mnod par bya ba nyid la spangs pa de ma spangs pa dang tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The relinquishment is not different from the one who has relinquished, and the property of one who has died is suitable only for the one who has taken it up.

original: spangs pa ni dge 'dun las tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'os pa nyid do //
analyzed: spangs pa ni dge 'dun las tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'os pa nyid do //
translated: The relinquishment is suitable because it is not different from the Saṅgha.

original: de'i shi ba'i yo byad la rang bzhen gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽tha dad pa'i la ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa gzhan la brten pas tha dad pa phyogs gzhan dang 'brel ba la ni /
analyzed: de'i shi ba'i yo byad la rang bzhen gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to // tha dad pa'i la ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa gzhan la brten pas tha dad pa phyogs gzhan dang 'brel ba la ni /
translated: The meaning is that the property of one who has died is to be used by those who remain.

original: tha dad pa nyid de phyogs gzhan las tha dad par gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid de phyogs gzhan las tha dad par gyur ba nyid do //
translated: In the case of a different one, it is different.🔽The meaning is that the property of one who has died is to be used by those who remain.

original: de'i de mnod pa nyid la gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa la 'os pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i de mnod pa nyid la gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa la 'os pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The property of one who has died that belongs to another faction is not suitable for those who belong to another faction.

original: chos dang mthun pa'i 'dod pa la brten pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i 'dod pa la brten pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is to be used by those who have a similar desire for the Dharma.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: khas blangs pa rnams kyi gnas su khas ma blangs pa'i dge tshul 'ongs te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa rnams kyi gnas su khas ma blangs pa'i dge tshul 'ongs te /
translated: If a novice monk who is not a party to the agreement comes to the place where the agreement was made,

original: dus byas par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus byas par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and if he dies, then the agreement is broken.

original: chos dang @127b mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas blangs pa yin la chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas ma blangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang @127b mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas blangs pa yin la chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas ma blangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that an agreement is made in accordance with the Dharma, and that an agreement is not made in accordance with what is contrary to the Dharma.🔽Others than the ordained and fellow brahmacharins are not entitled to it.

original: rab tu byung ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan pa dag de mi dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag las gzhan nye du la sogs pa dang / rgyal po la yang rab tu byung ba shi ba'i yo byad de mi dbang ba yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan pa dag de mi dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag las gzhan nye du la sogs pa dang / rgyal po la yang rab tu byung ba shi ba'i yo byad de mi dbang ba yin te /
translated: The possessions of an ordained person who has died belong only to ordained persons and to fellow brahmacharins. Relatives and so on, and even the king, are not entitled to the possessions of an ordained person who has died.

original: de ni rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag kho na dbang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag kho na dbang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they belong only to ordained persons and to fellow brahmacharins.

original: 'dir dge slong zhes ma smos pa ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma yang dbang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir dge slong zhes ma smos pa ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma yang dbang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the term bhikṣu is not mentioned because it is intended to apply to novices and female novices.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa zhes smos pa ni gzhan mu stegs can bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa zhes smos pa ni gzhan mu stegs can bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term those who practice pure conduct is used to exclude non-Buddhists.

original: gsol ba'am dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlabs zin pa na 'ongs pa ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad la byin gyis brlabs zin kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gsol ba'am dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlabs zin pa na 'ongs pa ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad la byin gyis brlabs zin kyang rung ste /
translated: If one arrives when the announcement has been made or when the first or last part of the consecration has been completed, one is not entitled. This refers to the consecration of the deceased's belongings, whether or not the consecration has been completed.

original: gang zhig zin pa na 'ongs pa de la yang de dag ni mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig zin pa na 'ongs pa de la yang de dag ni mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Even if one arrives when it has been completed, one is not entitled to it.

original: de ltar byung ba byin gyis brlab pa ma zin pa ni dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba byin gyis brlab pa ma zin pa ni dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: However, if the consecration of the deceased's belongings has not been completed, one is entitled to it.

original: lho phyogs su mtshan mo'i 'og tu 'di la byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: lho phyogs su mtshan mo'i 'og tu 'di la byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid du gsungs so //
translated: It is said that this consecration should be done in the south, after nightfall.

original: de la gang zhig mdun rol du byin gyis brlab pa gnyis po 'di byed par 'gyur ba des gzhan rnams la skal ba mi dbang ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba las de ma grags pa nyid kyi phyir las kyi cho ga las 'das pa zhes bya bar🔽rig par bya'o //🔽de las 'ga' zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan ba dang gsar bu gnyis la byin pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gang zhig mdun rol du byin gyis brlab pa gnyis po 'di byed par 'gyur ba des gzhan rnams la skal ba mi dbang ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba las de ma grags pa nyid kyi phyir las kyi cho ga las 'das pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // de las 'ga' zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan ba dang gsar bu gnyis la byin pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be known as “transgressing the ritual of the rite.”

original: de las zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad de las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad de las so //
translated: “From that” means “from that estate of the deceased.”

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig go //
translated: “Some” means “some thing.”

original: dge 'dun gyi rgan ba dang dge 'dun gyi gsar bu gnyis las byin pa ni dang po dang tha ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rgan ba dang dge 'dun gyi gsar bu gnyis las byin pa ni dang po dang tha ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Given to the senior monk and the junior monk of the saṅgha” means “to the first and last.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: yo byad gcig btsongs te cung zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan ba dang dge 'dun gyi gsar bu la byin nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yo byad gcig btsongs te cung zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan ba dang dge 'dun gyi gsar bu la byin nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Having sold one article, he gave a little to the senior monk and the junior monk of the saṅgha.”

original: de la don gyi dbang gis ni 'dir cung zhig nyid dang / nyo tshong yang nges pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la don gyi dbang gis ni 'dir cung zhig nyid dang / nyo tshong yang nges pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, by the power of the object, it is only a little, and buying and selling are not certain.

original: de bas na 'dir mdor byas so //🔽gang na byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'dug pa de'i mtshams su gtogs pa rnams byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas gang na byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i dngos po 'dug pa de'i mtshams su gtogs pa'i byin gyis rlob par byed
analyzed: de bas na 'dir mdor byas so // gang na byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'dug pa de'i mtshams su gtogs pa rnams byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas gang na byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i dngos po 'dug pa de'i mtshams su gtogs pa'i byin gyis rlob par byed
translated: Therefore, it is summarized here.

original: pa po rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa po rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The one who consecrates is the one who belongs to the same boundary as the object to be consecrated. This means that the one who consecrates belongs to the same boundary as the object to be consecrated.

original: 'di la shi ba'i gnas nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no @128a * //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la shi ba'i gnas nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no @128a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the place of death itself is not the cause.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'di la shi ba'i gnas nyid ni rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'di la shi ba'i gnas nyid ni rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: Here means in this consecration of the requisites for death. The place of death itself is not the cause.

original: 'dir shi ba de'i dbang gis mtshams de na gnas pa rnams kyis shi ba'i yo byad 'dug pa byin gyis brlab tu mi rung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir shi ba de'i dbang gis mtshams de na gnas pa rnams kyis shi ba'i yo byad 'dug pa byin gyis brlab tu mi rung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because of the death here, it is not suitable for those who live there to consecrate the articles of the dead person.

original: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa la lus sam gzhan gyis reg pas ji tsam non pa der gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa la lus sam gzhan gyis reg pas ji tsam non pa der gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are in the middle of the boundary are consecrated by the body or by another touching it, up to the extent that it is covered.

original: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa'i shi ba'i yo byad de la shi ba de'i lus kyis reg gam /
analyzed: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa'i shi ba'i yo byad de la shi ba de'i lus kyis reg gam /
translated: The articles of the dead person who is in the middle of the boundary are consecrated by the body of the dead person touching them,

original: gzhan gyis reg pa'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba des mtshams ji tsam non cing khyab pa'i mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis reg pa'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba des mtshams ji tsam non cing khyab pa'i mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin te /
translated: or by another touching the articles to be consecrated. The extent of the boundary is covered and the monks who belong to that boundary consecrate them.

original: 'di la ni byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i rdzas kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi shi ba'i ro'i dbang gis ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba de la brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la ni byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i rdzas kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi shi ba'i ro'i dbang gis ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba de la brjod pa ste /
translated: This is established by the power of the substance to be consecrated, not by the power of the dead body.

original: mdo 'di ni gleng gzhi rnams las so //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni gleng gzhi rnams las so //
translated: This sūtra is from the nidāna.

original: gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa'i khongs su yo byad gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni nor dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po de la khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba'i ni nor dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa'i khongs su yo byad gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni nor dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po de la khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba'i ni nor dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: That which is like wealth is included in the category of that which is like wealth. For a householder or one gone forth, that which becomes like wealth is like wealth.

original: de'i khongs su gtogs pa de ni de'i lus su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i khongs su gtogs pa de ni de'i lus su gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is included in that category is included in that person's body.

original: 'di 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is of the nature of being grasped by that person.

original: de khas len pa nyid la gang du 'di nor dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba de'i khongs su yo byad gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de khas len pa nyid la gang du 'di nor dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba de'i khongs su yo byad gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that in accepting that, that which is like wealth is included in the category of that which is like wealth.

original: de'i phyir nor dang 'dra bas gzhan na 'dug pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan na 'dug pas kyang shi ba'i yo byad kyi nor dang 'dra ba'i gang zag drung na 'dug pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nor dang 'dra bas gzhan na 'dug pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan na 'dug pas kyang shi ba'i yo byad kyi nor dang 'dra ba'i gang zag drung na 'dug pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is like wealth should be consecrated by one who is present elsewhere. The meaning is that even one who is present elsewhere should consecrate the wealth that is like the possessions of the deceased, in the presence of the person who is like the deceased.

original: bskur ba skur bar bya bas ma spangs pa ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bskur ba'i dngos po ma spangs pa ni gang gis skur bar byed pas bskur bar bya ba ni /🔽de nyid yin te bskur bar bya ba dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: bskur ba skur bar bya bas ma spangs pa ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bskur ba'i dngos po ma spangs pa ni gang gis skur bar byed pas bskur bar bya ba ni / de nyid yin te bskur bar bya ba dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: That which is to be disparaged is not abandoned by the disparager.🔽That which is abandoned is by the disparager.

original: spangs pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni skur bar byed pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid de dngos po ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spangs pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni skur bar byed pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid de dngos po ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is disparaged is the disparager.

original: des spangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des spangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if he abandons it,🔽he.

original: des zhes bya ba ni skur bar byed pa des so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni skur bar byed pa des so //
translated: By him means by the disparager.

original: gang la ste gang la skur bar byed pa de ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la ste gang la skur bar byed pa de ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is disparaged is abandoned.

original: 'dir skur bar byed pa spangs pa ni bshad pa la skur bar byed pa spangs bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir skur bar byed pa spangs pa ni bshad pa la skur bar byed pa spangs bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the disparager is explained as abandoned, but the disparaged is not abandoned.

original: gal te 'dis snga ma bzung @128b na 'dis bdag la ci zhig bya zhes bdag gis 'di spangs so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dis snga ma bzung @128b na 'dis bdag la ci zhig bya zhes bdag gis 'di spangs so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I have abandoned him.

original: de ltar yang skur bar byed pa nyid kyi de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yang skur bar byed pa nyid kyi de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, he is one who denigrates the Buddha, and the meaning of “connected with him” is just that.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag bskur nas gang la bskur ba des spangs nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag bskur nas gang la bskur ba des spangs nas /
translated: “If a monk sends robes to a monk, if the one to whom they are sent abandons them,

original: gang gis bskur ba des kyang spang na gang la bskur ba de yir byin gyis rlob na ni byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bskur ba des kyang spang na gang la bskur ba de yir byin gyis rlob na ni byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin no //
translated: and if the one who sent them also abandons them, then if the one to whom they were sent consecrates them as his own, they are not consecrated.

original: gang gis bskur ba de yir byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis bskur ba de yir byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: If the one who sent them consecrates them as his own, they are consecrated.

original: legs par byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: legs par byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: They are well consecrated.”

original: 'di mi rigs par shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di mi rigs par shes par mi bya ste /
translated: This should not be understood as unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i 'jug pa la mi dgos pa'i mi gtsang ba la bdag gis 'di dor ro snyam pa de lta bu'i blo dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i 'jug pa la mi dgos pa'i mi gtsang ba la bdag gis 'di dor ro snyam pa de lta bu'i blo dang 'dra'o //
translated: Because it is not necessary for such an engagement, it is like the thought, “I will discard this impurity.”

original: de'i dgos pa ni bdag po so so so sor byed cing de la yid brten nas rnam par gzhag pa shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis rlob pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa ni bdag po so so so sor byed cing de la yid brten nas rnam par gzhag pa shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis rlob pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The purpose of that is the individual owners, and relying on that, the establishment of the consecration of the articles of the dead, and so on.

original: phyi rol du yang mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa dag gis 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis rlob pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa dag gis 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis rlob pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also externally, those with the perception of the boundary do not consecrate alone.

original: phyi rol du yang zhes bya ba ni nang du ma byas pa la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang zhes bya ba ni nang du ma byas pa la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Also externally means the consecration of what is not done internally, and so on.

original: mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la yang gi sgra 'di ni ma grags so //🔽nang du 'du shes pa dag gis zhes bya ba mtshams kyi zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la yang gi sgra 'di ni ma grags so // nang du 'du shes pa dag gis zhes bya ba mtshams kyi zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Do not consecrate means the word also is not famous.🔽Those with the perception of internally means the boundary.

original: mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of those with the perception of the boundary is the meaning of those with the perception of internally.

original: 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig dag gis byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig dag gis byin gyis brlab po //
translated: The phrase only those who are consecrated means that only those who are consecrated can consecrate.

original: mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa rnams la phyi rol du yang byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba mi mthun pa dag ges byin gyis rlob par byed na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa rnams la phyi rol du yang byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba mi mthun pa dag ges byin gyis rlob par byed na mi 'chags so //
translated: If those who are consecrated consecrate those who are outside the boundary, thinking that they are inside the boundary, then the consecration is valid. The phrase only those who are consecrated means that those who are not consecrated cannot consecrate.

original: mi 'chags par mi bya'o zhes spyir bstan pa des 'di la nyes byas su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'chags par mi bya'o zhes spyir bstan pa des 'di la nyes byas su shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase it is not to be done is a general statement, and it should be understood that there is an offense for violating it.

original: yid gnyis za ba la yang yid gnyis ni mtshams kyi nang du de smos pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis za ba la yang yid gnyis ni mtshams kyi nang du de smos pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase those who are consecrated should be understood to mean those who are consecrated inside the boundary.

original: gang zhig phyi rol du mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa'am yid gnyis za bas rku sems kyis byin gyis rlob par byed na rku sems de la nyes pa sbom por byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig phyi rol du mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa'am yid gnyis za bas rku sems kyis byin gyis rlob par byed na rku sems de la nyes pa sbom por byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If someone, thinking that those who are outside the boundary are inside the boundary, or if someone who is unsure, consecrates with a thieving attitude, then the thieving attitude is considered a serious offense.

original: de'i phyir rku sems la nyes pa sbom por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rku sems la nyes pa sbom por rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the thieving attitude should be understood as a serious offense.

original: btsun pa gang zhig mtshams kyi nang du rku sems kyis sngar phrogs pa nyid kyi phyir nyes pa sbom por byas na ni dngos po @129a * //
analyzed: btsun pa gang zhig mtshams kyi nang du rku sems kyis sngar phrogs pa nyid kyi phyir nyes pa sbom por byas na ni dngos po @129a * //
translated: If a monk steals with the intention to steal what is inside a boundary, he commits a serious offense.🔽

original: las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If a monk, with the intention to steal, takes back what he had previously stolen while inside the boundary, then the offense of a serious transgression is established on the basis of the object.🔽If he takes it back outside the boundary, then the offense is a minor infraction.

original: dbyung ba dang rim gro dang chos mnyan pa dang yon bshad pa ma byas bar byin gyis brlab par ma bya'o //
analyzed: dbyung ba dang rim gro dang chos mnyan pa dang yon bshad pa ma byas bar byin gyis brlab par ma bya'o //
translated: He should not give his approval without first performing the duties of expelling, serving, listening to the Dharma, and explaining the gifts.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim gzhan na 'dug pa nyid ni khyim bdag gis gang la byin pa de dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim gzhan na 'dug pa nyid ni khyim bdag gis gang la byin pa de dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the almsbowl and robes are in the house, then the householder has control over them.

original: gal te dbang zhing des phongs pa yin na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te dbang zhing des phongs pa yin na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he has control and is in need, then he should give his approval.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: gleng gzhi rnams las de mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnams las de mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The bases are concluded here.

original: khyim bdag gis gang la byin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag yongs su ma smos pas gcig dang du ma zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gis gang la byin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag yongs su ma smos pas gcig dang du ma zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is not specified, it should be understood that “what the householder gives” refers to both one and many.

original: gal te 'di khyim pa dang mu stegs pa'i rab tu byung ba dang / 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba'am mtshams tha dad pa gzhan la byin bar gyur na ci de la yang dbang ba nyid dam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di khyim pa dang mu stegs pa'i rab tu byung ba dang / 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba'am mtshams tha dad pa gzhan la byin bar gyur na ci de la yang dbang ba nyid dam zhe na /
translated: If it is given to a layperson, to a renunciate of another sect, or to a renunciate of this sect, but in a different region, is it still a relinquishing?

original: de'i phyir gal te dbang zhing zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te dbang zhing zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, “If it is given to one who has control over it.”

original: gang la rnyed pa de yod na gal te dbang ba de la byin par gyur na ci de la yang rnyed pa tsam gyi dbang gis de dbang ba nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang la rnyed pa de yod na gal te dbang ba de la byin par gyur na ci de la yang rnyed pa tsam gyi dbang gis de dbang ba nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is given to one who has control over it, is it still a relinquishing?

original: phongs pa yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phongs pa yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is given to one who is in need.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is:

original: med de 'dir yang cho ga 'di sbyar ba zhes bya ba de bas na de la mngon par brten pa'o //
analyzed: med de 'dir yang cho ga 'di sbyar ba zhes bya ba de bas na de la mngon par brten pa'o //
translated: “No, for this rule applies here as well. Therefore, it is based on that.”

original: gal te khyim bdag sbyin ba'i phyir 'jug par mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te khyim bdag sbyin ba'i phyir 'jug par mi byed na /
translated: If the householder does not give it,

original: de'i tshe su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: then to whom does it belong?

original: de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed na blangs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin par mi byed na blangs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, “If it is not given, it belongs to the one who took it up.”

original: 'dir yang dbang zhing des phongs pa'o zhes bya ba dbang du bya ba dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dbang zhing des phongs pa'o zhes bya ba dbang du bya ba dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, “one who is powerless and destitute” should be understood as referring to one who is powerless and one who is destitute.
